title: Senior Software Engineer (Fullstack: .NET/React/AWS)
description:
**What We Do At Qliro**
 At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.
   

  

**What Your Team Does**
 Earlier Qliro focused on a few big customers, today we have pivoted and now we are going for the entire e-com market, starting in the Nordics but aiming to be a European leader. To succeed we must automate the system configurations. We also need to build the new best-in-class tooling where merchants can onboard themselves.
   

  

 Your new team owns the automation and self-configuration tools. This is a greenfield project based upon AWS step-functions, .NET and React. We fully own our domain, where to go and how to get there.
   

  

 We believe that you work best autonomously and thrive in collaboration with others. You think greenfield is exciting where you have an impact on the vision and take a broader role in developing our products. Working together with other teams, PMs and stakeholders comes naturally. You are comfortable in both frontend and backend and can elevate the view to lead architectural discoveries when needed.
   

  

**What You Will Bring To The Team**
* 5+ years as a fullstack engineer
* Fearless to dive into architectural discussions and explore on your own
* Modern Javascript framework and .NET or JAVA in backend


**Tech stack**
* React
* .NET
* AWS (various tools)
* Cypress
* Microservices


 We're excited to hear from you!
   

  

*Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual* 
 orientation
 *or age.*

title: Java Developer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att forma din karriär precis som du önskar. Här blir du en del av en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap av engagerade kollegor världen över. Tillsammans utmanar vi gränserna för vad som är möjligt. Följ med oss och bidra till att hjälpa världens ledande organisationer att maximera teknikens potential och skapa en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Hos oss på Capgemini får du inte bara jobba med Java – du får forma framtiden. Vi ligger i framkant när det gäller Generative AI, Data Engineering och skalbara molnplattformar. Våra projekt ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas inom cutting-edge teknologier som Java, Spring, AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, OpenShift, Kafka, GraphQL, React, Angular och Android. På vårt Stockholmskontor trivs vi i rymliga, ljusa lokaler med daglig frukost, nybryggt kaffe och en fantastisk utsikt över kanalen vid Barnhusbron.
   

  

*I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:*
 Arbeta som Java Developer i spännande konsultuppdrag tillsammans med ett supporterande team omkring dig.
   

  

 Främja samarbete, proaktiv problemlösning och högkvalitativ leverans av Java-baserad programvara.
   

  

 Utnyttja din erfarenhet av Java, Spring och relaterade teknologier för att designa och utveckla robusta, skalbara och effektiva backend-system.
   

  

 Förmåga att handleda andra utvecklare, genomföra kodgranskningar och driva bästa praxis.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Minst 4 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
   

  

 Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
   

  

 Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som AWS, GCP eller Azure är meriterande
   

  

 Kunskap inom Data Pipeline, Data Visualization eller Generative AI är ett stort plus
   

  

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Oavsett om du vill axla rollen som tech lead, fördjupa dig i arkitektur eller bli specialist inom en viss teknologi, får du här alla verktyg för att lyckas. Vi arbetar med kunder i olika branscher, vilket betyder att du ständigt står inför stimulerande tekniska utmaningar. Hos oss är kunskap och utveckling i fokus – vi erbjuder certifieringar, utbildningar och mentorskap för att du alltid ska ligga steget före.
   

  

 En arbetsmiljö med kollegor som stöttar och inspirerar varandra, och chefer som har ditt bästa i fokus, samt ett brett utbud av karriärmöjligheter och tillgång till Capgeminis stora utbildningskatalog, särskilt inom den senaste teknologin för generativ AI och data engineering. En företagskultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts högt, samt möjligheter till internationella karriärer och ett fantastiskt nätverk av 340,000 kollegor globalt.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i karriären? Vi kan knappt vänta på att få höra från dig! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är det dig vi letar efter? Vi ser fram emot att ses!
   

  

 Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Just nu har vi semesterperiod och hoppas även du njuter av en fin sommar! Vi kommer jobba löpande i denna rekryteringsprocess och du kommer att få återkoppling på din ansökan i augusti månad på grund av semestertider. Stort tack för ditt tålamod!
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Tracab: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of the team behind the world’s most accurate optical tracking system for football? At TRACAB, we develop real-time solutions that have been used in some of the world’s biggest events, such as the FIFA World Cup, as well as by top football leagues including Bundesliga, LaLiga and MLS. Every match day, our technology transforms how fans, analysts, and teams experience the game.
   

  

 As a Software Developer with Tracab, you will play an integral role in designing, implementing, and maintaining applications primarily in NodeJS/TypeScript. You will work closely with our team to deliver highly stable, scalable, and real-time code solutions that power game statistics and player tracking at top sports venues around the world. This role will also involve collaborating on the development of KPIs for various stakeholders across the sports industry. To support our real-time systems, experience with Docker, Kubernetes, MongoDB, Redis, and RabbitMQ is essential.
   

  

 E.g., if the client requires statistics to understand player passing patterns better, you will write the code, evaluate, test and implement your solution within the platform. You are a part of the whole chain and within a couple of weeks you can see your results in a game when you watch TV.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain server-side applications primarily in NodeJS/TypeScript, with a focus on real-time systems.
* Implement and optimize real-time communication channels, including WebSockets, for highly responsive applications.
* Build and optimize APIs and backend services for performance, scalability, and reliability in real-time environments.
* Leverage Docker and Kubernetes to deploy and manage services in a containerized environment.
* Utilize MongoDB, Redis, and RabbitMQ as backend databases, optimizing data handling for performance and scalability.
* Write well-tested, stable, and maintainable code with an emphasis on best practices and code quality.
* Collaborate with other engineers and stakeholders to refine requirements, develop new features, and troubleshoot issues.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to a culture of continuous learning and improvement.


**Requirements**
* MSc. in computer science or equivalent level of knowledge.
* Proven experience as a Software Developer with expertise in NodeJS/TypeScript.
* Familiarity with real-time communication technologies, such as WebSockets, and handling high-throughput, low-latency requirements.
* Strong experience with Docker and Kubernetes for containerized applications.
* Proficiency with MongoDB, Redis, and RabbitMQ, including an understanding of when to use each for optimal application performance.
* Experience developing scalable and high-performance applications.
* Demonstrated ability to write clean, testable, and maintainable code.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
* Fluent in English, in writing and speaking.


 Nice-to-haves
   

  

* Knowledge of other languages (e.g., Go, Rust, Terraform).
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps best practices.
* Knowledge of microservices architecture and distributed systems.
* Basic knowledge in building native Windows desktop apps


***Interviews will start in mid August due to summer vacation.***
**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Perception Software Engineer
description:
**Company**
 Qualcomm Auto Ltd Sweden Filial
   

  

**Job Area**
 Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering
   

  

**General Summary**
 Are you passionate about advancing
 **ADAS** 
 and
 **Autonomous Driving** 
 systems? Imagine contributing to a safer world while collaborating with brilliant, creative, and enjoyable colleagues. Dive into exciting and challenging technology—apply today for this rewarding opportunity!
   

  

**We are Perception within Qualcomm Automotive**
 Qualcomm is an American multinational corporation known for our creation of semiconductors, software, and services related to wireless technology.
   

  

 Our Perception organization belong to the Automotive branch delivering the Snapdragon Digital Chassis - a set of cloud-connected platforms for telematics and connectivity, digital cockpit, and driver assistance and autonomy.
   

  

 As a Perception Software Engineer at Qualcomm Automotive, you will design, develop, create, modify and validate state-of-the-art computer vision software for autonomous driving and advanced driver assistance systems. You will be part of Requirement Area Spatial Awareness, working closely with experts in different areas within computer vision. You will have the opportunity to contribute with your expertise as well as learn from other highly skilled developers. Together you develop algorithms for Detection of Freespace, i.e. Drivable area for the vehicle, enabling autonomous braking, adaptive cruise control and high-level autonomy.
   

  

 As a member of one of our cross functional teams, you will be performing tasks covering all parts of the product development cycle, including software design, machine learning, hands on work with data, testing, writing requirements and functional safety.
   

  

**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 4+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.


 OR
   

  

 Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 3+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
   

  

 OR
   

  

 PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Software Engineering or related work experience.
   

  

* 2+ years of work experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.


 As a person, we are looking for you who have a drive and “can do”-attitude, as well as the willingness to learn and expand your skillset in new areas. We also believe you are highly motivated and a pragmatic problem solver. Preferably, you also have previous experience from leadership positions as Team Lead or Tech Lead.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who matches at least 2-3 of the descriptions below:
   

  

* Software Development: You have a robust software development background, preferably complemented by expertise in system design and architecture (required).
* Language and Tools: Proficiency in languages and tools for machine learning and SW development, particularly and C/C++, python and tensorflow.
* Machine Learning: You bring practical experience in machine learning development, gained from relevant industry contexts. This includes practical experience of working with and developing the datasets used.
* Computer Vision: You have experience from applying algorithms to solve complex problems within Computer Vision.


**Preferred Qualification**
* Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering Physics, Machine Learning, Computer Science or related field.
* 8+ years of Software Engineering, Computer Vision, Machine learning and/or related work experience.
* 1+ years in leadership position (Team Lead, Tech Lead, Project Lead or similar)
* References to a particular number of years experience are for indicative purposes only. Applications from candidates with equivalent experience will be considered, provided that the candidate can demonstrate an ability to fulfill the principal duties of the role and possesses the required competencies.


 Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer. If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application/hiring process, rest assured that Qualcomm is committed to providing an accessible process. You may e-mail disability-accomodations@qualcomm.com or call Qualcomm's toll-free number found here. Upon request, Qualcomm will provide reasonable accommodations to support individuals with disabilities to be able participate in the hiring process. Qualcomm is also committed to making our workplace accessible for individuals with disabilities. (Keep in mind that this email address is used to provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We will not respond here to requests for updates on applications or resume inquiries).
   

  

 Qualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.
   

  

**To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies** 
 : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.
   

  

 If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

title: ServiceNow Developer for a leading IT Company in Sweden
company_industry: Software Development, IT System Custom Software Development, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**ServiceNow Developer for a leading IT Company in Sweden** 




  





*\*Please note that only Swedish-speaking candidates will be considered for the further interview process* 




  





 This reputable IT company is dedicated to modernizing the IT landscape for its clients, driving efficiency, agility, and innovation to achieve their digital ambitions. Serving large organizations across various industries and the public sector, they focus on ServiceNow as a leading IT Service Management platform within the market. Currently, they are seeking a skilled ServiceNow Developer to lead innovation and excellence within their team of developers.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Implement ServiceNow modules ITSM and HR for our customers.
* Able to implement integration using REST API or any other standard integration platforms available.
* Contribute as ServiceNow developer in projects ranging from simple to complex.
* Analyze and resolve production issues around implemented solution based on ServiceNow.
* Handle code migration from development to test to production instances of ServiceNow.
* Support end users with queries around ServiceNow based implemented solution.



  





  





**Requirements:** 



* Certified ServiceNow Administrator and preferably Certified Implementation Specialist in ITSM and CSM
* Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in ServiceNow developer working for clients
* Strong technical knowledge about on-premise ServiceNow ITSM and CSM module
* Candidates with strong experience in implementing ServiceNow native automation capabilities are preferred.
* Proven track record working in ServiceNow platform as technical consultant.Analyses and improves current implementation and solutions.



  





  





**As a person you are:** 



* Demonstrated ability to communicate well with customers and within organization
* Well-spoken, articulate and communicative
* Self-managed and well organized
* Natural ability to work in global environment and people



  





  





**Benefits:** 



* Growth-oriented work environment with mentorship and professional development opportunities
* Comprehensive health benefits including sports compensation, dental and vision coverage, healthy office snacks, sick leave compensation from the first day of absence, and company-covered doctor visits
* The hybrid work model and flexible working hours

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

 Long Description
   

  

**Your Role**
 As an Embedded Software Developer, you will focus on developing embedded software, mainly but not exclusively within the Automotive Industry.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Developing software using C and C++ programming languages.
* Using MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and potentially generating C code.
* Writing unit tests or other test cases (Python).
* Working with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**Your Profile**
* At least 5 years of experience with embedded programming in C/C++.
* Experience with MATLAB and Simulink.
* Experience with hardware-related programming and debugging, including JTAG and other debugging tools.
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS) and experience with embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities, staying ahead of the curve in the ever-evolving automotive landscape.


**Application and Contact**
 Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span. For questions and for more information, contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, at 0725-616900.
   

  

 Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
   

  

 We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Backend Developer – Installation and Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Developer on our Installations & Customer Care team, you'll help transform how clean energy gets delivered by empowering the field workforce with intuitive, data-driven tools. This team focuses on digitalizing installation operations and supporting ongoing maintenance and customer care. You’ll work at the intersection of software and real-world impact, building solutions that help installers and technicians do their best work every day.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build intelligent backend systems that replace manual paperwork and disconnected workflows with scalable digital tools—bringing structure, traceability, and efficiency to field operations
* Develop services that simplify collaboration and handovers between installers, planners, and support teams, ensuring smooth transitions and fewer dropped balls across the customer journey
* Create platforms that collect and leverage operational data, helping us identify patterns, drive continuous improvement, and make smarter decisions at scale
* Design infrastructure that empowers a traditionally non-digital workforce to adopt and rely on intuitive tools, enabling them to focus on delivering high-quality installations
* Support post-installation care by enabling proactive maintenance, diagnostics, and revisit scheduling—improving long-term outcomes for both customers and the business
* Help us scale into new regions and markets by building flexible systems that adapt to varying local requirements, work practices, and service models


 We’re changing how clean energy is installed and maintained—making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you’re excited about building backend systems that empower people in the field and drive tangible outcomes, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
* Experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Automated testing at different levels (unit tests, integration tests etc.)


**Nice to have:**
* Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
* Databases (DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, continuous delivery, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum, and/or a combination of both
* Digitalization and modernisation of manual labour


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: App Developer - Installation and Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an App Developer on our Installation & Customer Care team, you'll build the digital tools that empower our field workforce to deliver clean energy solutions efficiently. You'll work across mobile apps, backend systems and web platforms to create seamless experiences for installers, technicians, and support teams.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Own, build and maintain our installer mobile app using Flutter for iOS and Android
* Design digital workflows that replace manual paperwork and improve operational efficiency
* Build systems that enable real-time collaboration between installers, planners, and customer care
* Develop data collection and reporting tools to drive continuous improvement


 We're digitizing how clean energy gets installed and maintained. If you enjoy building tools that have real-world impact and working across the full technology stack, this role is for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Flutter development experience for mobile app development
* Interest in digitizing manual processes and field operations
* Experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)


**Nice to have:**
* Backend development skills (Java experience) OR React and Typescript experience
* Understanding of databases and API development
* Experience at fast-growing companies


****Please note:****
****As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.****
****Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!****
**What is in it for you?**
* Work at a fast-growing clean energy company making a real environmental impact
* Build tools that directly help field teams deliver clean energy solutions
* Collaborate with international teams and launch products globally
* Work across web, mobile, and backend technologies
* Hybrid work flexibility at our new Stockholm office near public transport
* Supportive, inclusive culture with career advancement opportunities


 At Aira, we believe diverse teams build better products. We welcome people from all backgrounds to help us create a cleaner energy future.

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**About The Position**
 Join us and our mission to fight cancer! We are looking for a Salesforce Developer to our Salesforce team in Stockholm.
   

  

 Salesforce is an important platform to us and is used widely within our company (Marketing, Sales, Service, Quality and our Product teams). Together with the team you will play a key role in bringing our platform to the next level!
   

  

 You will work with our experienced team of 3 developers and a senior team lead with our stakeholders to deliver scalable and robust solutions to our employees and customers. The team works closely with many teams across the company and big initiatives are defined and prioritized and together with the team and Head of IT.
   

  

 With our team you will be able to work on the following Salesforce products: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, Shield, Account Engagement (Pardot) and Experience cloud. On top of that we also own our integrations to platforms such as AWS and Azure.
   

  

 We work agile and deliver our business value in iterations. We know Salesforce best-practice and we are not afraid of adding custom logic (Apex, LWC components etc.) to bring that extra flavor to our users!
   

  

**You Will Mainly Work With**
* Bringing business value by building new functionality or improving existing logic using Apex, LWC or flows.
* Be involved in our strategic planning and help us identify improvements to our architecture and deployment process.
* Working to make our environment easy to use and with data points that the business can follow up on.


 Your profile
   

  

 We believe that you are a positive and opportunistic person that thrive in an ever-changing environment. You seek to find the business value and usability in things and don't mind making an extra effort to deliver something you can be proud of!
   

  

 You have great communication skills and don't mind communicating directly with stakeholders or end-users.
   

  

**Experience & Skills**
* Education in relevant area or comparable experience.
* +3 years experience as developer on the Salesforce platform.
* Great experience using Apex, trigger frameworks and LWC components.
* Experience with Sales Cloud and Service Cloud (experience in CPQ or Revenue Cloud is extra bonus).
* Experience in CI/CD is appreciated.
* Excellent communication skills in English


 Our office
   

  

 In order to continue with our important mission – to improve cancer care across the world - it’s important to us that our employees have a positive working environment. Our headquarters are at Torsplan, Hagastaden, in Stockholm’s Life Science Hub. In our newly constructed office both workplaces and social spaces are tastefully decorated. Every day our bistro serves something to eat in the morning and in the afternoon. Our own kitchen staff also prepares an amazing lunch spread with new themes every day.
   

  

 We have our own gym where you can work out before work, on your way home or at lunch with your colleagues. We have yoga and work out sessions on a regular basis.
   

  

 On our top floor we have a roof top terrace with 360 degrees view of the city and an entire floor dedicated to social activities. Here we have a ping pong table, fussball, a grand piano, chess tournaments, game board nights and a weekly after work.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Please apply to the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Team Lead- Business Developer
description:
**Teamledare – Affärsutveckling på Leyton Sverige**
**Om Leyton Sverige**
 Leyton Sverige är en del av Leyton Group, som grundades 2021 i Sverige. Vi är specialiserade på att hjälpa innovativa och tillverkande företag att få tillgång till finansiering för att utveckla sin verksamhet och upprätthålla sin konkurrenskraft. Genom våra högkvalitativa finansiella konsulttjänster gör vi en konkret skillnad för både våra kunder och den svenska ekonomin.
   

  

**Vad Vi Gör**
 På Leyton hjälper vi företag att optimera sina kostnader och öka sina besparingar genom innovativa finansiella lösningar. Våra tjänster är skräddarsydda för att stödja deras tillväxt och utveckling. Med vår unika framgångsbaserade avgiftsmodell betalar kunderna endast om de uppnår faktiska besparingar. Vi tar inte ut några förskottsavgifter och kräver ingen budgetplanering i förväg – vårt mål är att alla potentiella kunder ska kunna få tillgång till våra tjänster utan risk.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
 Som teamledare – affärsutveckling kommer du att spela en central roll i att driva företagets tillväxt samtidigt som du leder ett dynamiskt team. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Leda och handleda ett team av affärsutvecklare och främja en samarbetsinriktad och prestationsinriktad kultur.
* Samarbeta med ledande befattningshavare inom olika branscher för att boka möten och generera leads.
* Kvalificera potentiella kunder och se till att ditt team effektivt avslutar affärer och odlar långsiktiga kundrelationer.
* Spåra och uppdatera information i CRM-systemet för att säkerställa noggrannhet i teamets prestationsövervakning.
* Utveckla och implementera strategiska planer för att öka teamets produktivitet och uppnå försäljningsmål.


**Vi söker någon som**
* Drivs av att uppnå mål och överträffa förväntningar, både individuellt och i team.
* Trivs i en prestationsbaserad miljö med stort inflytande över individuell och teamers ersättning.
* Har en stark önskan att utvecklas personligt och professionellt och strävar efter att bli den bästa versionen av sig själv.
* Tycker om utmaningar och är villig att gå utanför sin komfortzon för att uppnå resultat.
* Har nyfikenhet och önskan att vara en del av en spännande tillväxtresa.


**Varför Du Inte Bör Söka**
* Om du ogillar att arbeta mot uppsatta mål och deadlines.
* Om du inte är intresserad av personlig utveckling eller konstruktiv feedback.
* Om du föredrar en statisk arbetsmiljö och vill stanna inom din komfortzon.


**Varför Du Bör Söka**
* Om du vill sälja tjänster som verkligen gör skillnad för företag och samhället.
* Om du tror att det är lätt att sälja tjänster som i princip är ”gratis” för kunden.
* Om du trivs med spänningen i att avsluta affärer och skriva kontrakt.
* Om du är ivrig att utveckla dina säljfärdigheter och ha direkt påverkan på dina intäkter genom en attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att växa professionellt.
* En attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter inom försäljning och affärsutveckling.
* Chansen att påverka både företagets framgång och din egen karriär.
* En teamorienterad atmosfär där dina insatser uppskattas och belönas.
* 30 dagars semester, privat sjukförsäkring och pensionsförmåner.


 Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär? Sluta läsa och kom och växa med oss!

title: Workday PSA Administrator
description:
For the past 20 years, ProPharma has improved the health and wellness of patients by providing advice and expertise that empowers biotech, med device, and pharmaceutical organizations of all sizes to confidently advance scientific breakthroughs and introduce new therapies. ProPharma partners with its clients through an advise-build-operate model across the complete product lifecycle. With deep domain expertise in regulatory sciences, clinical research solutions, quality & compliance, pharmacovigilance, medical information, and R&D technology, ProPharma offers an end-to-end suite of fully customizable consulting solutions that de-risk and accelerate our partners’ most high-profile drug and device programs.
   

  

**Essential Functions**
* Responsible for providing ongoing technical support and maintenance for the Workday PSA functional areas, including configuration, business processes and related security.
* Own the responsibility for the Global Service Desk ticket queue for PSA functional tickets. Ensure that tickets are resolved in a timely manner in accordance with applicable SLAs.
* Gather requirements for improvements and new functionalities through collaboration with cross-functional business teams and develop the solution to meet the business needs.
* Evaluate existing functionalities and ensure they continue to meet the needs of the business.
* Monitor existing functionalities and troubleshoot and correct any errors or failures on a timely basis.
* Collaborate with the Workday Integration Developer as the Workday PSA subject matter expert to support any related integrations.
* Create and maintain process documents as needed.
* Serve as the Workday PSA Lead for Workday projects, including optimization, implementation of new features and integrations of future acquisitions.
* Create and document test scenarios to validate configuration, execute the test scenarios and / or provides the test scenarios to other teams for testing, provides inputs on PSA considerations and dependencies to the Testing Leads to ensure sufficient PSA testing coverage for acquisition integrations and other major changes to the system (releases, new functionality, etc.).
* Support the process for review and testing of semi-annual Workday releases and ensure any issues identified in the PSA functional areas are researched and resolved during the release testing window.
* Act as SME for Kainos SmartTest PSA testing.
* Participate in the Workday Community and other resources, including training and user groups, to establish awareness of current trends, enhancements, releases, and system bugs.
* Work closely with IT Service Management and the Workday Product Team to secure optimal uptime, performance, and usage of the product.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Necessary Skills And Abilities**
* Advanced knowledge in Workday PSA functional areas, including but not limited to Projects, Customer Contracts, Billing Schedules, and Project Billing.
* Knowledge of Workday security structure as it relates to the above noted functional areas.
* Comprehension of the interrelationships between the various functional areas within Workday.
* Must have a can-do attitude along with an ability to learn new skills.
* Motivated, possesses self-awareness and a demonstrated ability to collaborate with other high-performing team members.
* Outstanding organizational, prioritization, multitasking, and time management skills.
* Ability to work with cross-functional teams to drive projects, gather requirements, provide development estimates, and meet expected delivery timelines.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills needed to work effectively with non-technical functional team members and business owners.
* Ability to adapt to multiple changing business priorities with calm and ease.
* Motivated and have a demonstrated ability to collaborate with other high-performing team members.


**Educational Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science or similar, or equivalent combination of education and work experience.


**Experience Requirements**
* 5+ years of direct experience configuring, maintaining, and optimizing Workday PSA functional areas.
* Workday Time Tracking experience a plus.
* Relevant Workday Certifications a plus.
* A combination of implementation and operational experience is preferred.


 We celebrate our differences and strive to create a workplace where each person can be their authentic self. We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Employees are encouraged to unleash their innovative, collaborative, and entrepreneurial spirits. With a holistic approach as an Equal Opportunity Employer, we provide a safe space where all employees feel empowered to succeed.
   

  

 \*\*\*ProPharma Group does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters/third parties. Please, no phone calls or emails to anyone regarding this posting.\*\*\*

title: Senior Software Engineer - Rendering
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Electronic Arts Inc. is a global leader in interactive entertainment. We develop and deliver games, content and online services across platforms. We have a broad portfolio of brands that span the most popular genres.
   

  

 We exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow our employees to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers.
   

  

 Join us in driving the next revolution in games.
   

  

**Frostbite**
 Frostbite is EA's state-of-the-art multi-platform game development engine. Our global team empowers game creators to shape the future of gaming by developing creative engine features and outstanding tools. We are honored to have thousands of game developers all over the world using Frostbite to create some of the most amazing games and player experiences in the industry.
   

  

 You will be part of an experienced and passionate team that owns the image quality for the engine: lighting, shadows, global illumination, materials, post-processing, display mapping, etc.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a senior rendering engineer on the Image Quality team, you will:
   

  

* Design, develop and maintain our high-level, predominantly visual rendering features in Frostbite
* Collaborate with game team engineers, as well as with the Image Quality and wider Frostbite rendering teams to deliver new rendering features and systems
* Support our game team engineers and artists in adopting, using, and debugging rendering features in Frostbite
* Mentor other engineers in the team


**Qualifications**
* Good communication skills, particularly when collaborating with artists.
* Strong C++ knowledge with at least 8 years of professional programming experience in real-time rendering
* Experience working in rendering on current or last-generation consoles (PS4, XB1, Switch, PS5, XBSX, PC)
* Experience in one or more modern graphics APIs (DX12, Vulkan, console, etc)
* Good knowledge of modern cpu/gpu hardware architectures
* Experience with Graphics Debugging Tools (PIX, Renderdoc, console tools, etc)
* Experience with memory management and multi-threading, with related debugging and optimization experience
* Significant experience using source control systems (p4, git) in large code bases


**Bonus Qualifications**
* Good theoretical knowledge on lighting, material response, etc
* Experience in any of the following: dynamic GI systems, shadowmap rendering/application, raytraced reflections, denoising, post-process effects, ocean/cloth/hair rendering, display mapping, TAA/upscaling…


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: System Architect
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Would you like to be part of a world class team that is writing the history of one of the most complex and exciting transformations in the telco industry around Mobile Voice Core and Telco Cloud area? I am Olle Welander, the leader of our Development team within Voice Core Networks.
   

  

 Right now, we are looking for a Senior or Junior System Architect in the Telia Voice Core domain. The team is responsible for managing the design, development and architecture of Voice Core systems for consumer and business voice services in five Nordic countries. For this reason, we accept applications from all over the Nordics and Baltics where Telia has Voice Core Systems.
   

  

**As a System Architect…**
 Our teams are distributed in Stockholm, Oslo and Helsinki and you will be part of an international organization working agile, and in the forefront of mobile technologies including IMS, 5G voice, cloud and automation. You will be interacting closely with other parts of Telia and our many suppliers, such as Ericsson, Nokia, Huawei, Sinch and Titanium.
   

  

 Your main responsibility will be to act as a System Architect in our development projects and EPICS. You will be working in teams with operations and production management towards the Vendors and other teams and departments at Telia.
   

  

 The role includes but not limited to maintaining a sound system architecture and managing the system design and architecture across development projects. You will be responsible for keeping development roadmaps up to date, performing design and requirements analysis during system procurement, and writing or reviewing high- and low-level design documentation. You will also manage system security by applying security-by-design principles and collaborate closely with operations, production management, and testing teams, while also handling technical vendor management.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For...**
 We are on a journey to become the new generation telco, which means that you need to be open-minded and not be afraid of change. And to really enjoy your job here, you need to be forward-thinking, customer-oriented and truly understand that the solutions you are creating will connect people in society to what matters most to them. You always want to learn more and are not afraid of new opportunities, and you are or aspire to be a technical expert in the Voice Telecom area. You are a problem solver who is forward-thinking and analytical in your approach, and you cooperate well in team efforts.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should have Mobile Voice Core and IMS competence with a solid understanding of telecom technologies, including architecture, functions, interfaces, and protocols. Preferably, you have experience in system architecture, development, engineering, integration, testing, and configuration. You are fluent in English, both written and spoken, and have a relevant technical education.
   

  

 For this position we are looking for either an Experienced Senior or Junior System Architect/Developer. Below you will find specific experience that we value for this position. Seniors will match more and Juniors at least a few. Both will harbor a burning desire and interest to become an expert in the Voice Core domain.
   

  

* Core Technologies and networks. IMS, 2G/3G/4G/5G mobile networks, telecom network design, SIP and Diameter signaling, STP/SS7, circuit-switched systems.
* Platforms and automation. System automation, Kubernetes (deployment and management), cloud-based applications and services (deployment, testing, design, dimensioning), AI-driven telco configuration and automation.
* Development and architecture. Writing HLD/LLD documentation, telco system requirement handling, technical roadmap planning, IP network basics, network dimensioning, telco security design.
* WoW and vendor experience. SAFe/Agile methodologies, experience working with vendors such as Nokia, Ericsson, Sinch, or NetNumber.


**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

*(For Lithuanian applicants only: Monthly salary range for this position in Lithuania: 3,900 – 5,800 EUR before tax deduction.)*
**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-08-15. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me Olle Welander at olle.welander@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Implementation Manager
description:
DeLaval, a world-leading developer and supplier of innovative solutions for dairy farmers, is on the lookout for an Implementation Manager to join our dynamic team in Digital Services. If you're passionate about making a meaningful impact in sustainable food production, this is your opportunity to shine.
   

  

 The Digital Services Unit at DeLaval is at the forefront of our company's digital transformation, enabling empowerment and innovation. Our mission is to empower DeLaval Dealers, DeLaval Employees, and DeLaval Farmers, helping them go faster, get closer, and go further. By providing meaningful innovation and service, we strive to enable our customers to achieve what was once considered impossible in dairy production, ultimately driving sustainable and profitable operations.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As an Implementation Manager, you will play a key supporting role in the execution and delivery of DeLaval Plus services. Working closely with the Senior Implementation Manager and cross-functional teams, your mission is to contribute to high-quality, well-coordinated implementation activities across markets. You will be involved in go-to-market projects and support operational rollouts of our digital services and solutions.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Support the market introduction of digital services by coordinating implementation activities aligned with the Commercial Offering and cluster organization.
* Contribute to the operational readiness of digital services by maintaining support materials, managing Help Center content, and coordinating with internal teams to ensure clear and consistent implementation guidance.
* Assist Market Areas and sales territories in executing implementation plans, offering hands-on support, resolving issues, and ensuring operational readiness.
* Actively participate in dialogues with DeLaval's teams, dealers, and customers, helping to gather insights and strengthen engagement.
* Contribute to continuous improvement efforts by identifying opportunities to streamline the implementation process and support quality assurance.
* Maintain clear and organized documentation and keep a strong focus on customer satisfaction throughout the implementation lifecycle.


**Qualifications And Experience**
 To thrive in this role, you should possess:
   

  

* University degree in business administration, Agriculture, Dairy Science, or a related field is required.
* High-level familiarity with the agri/dairy industry, understanding market trends, challenges, and opportunities characterizes industry knowledge.
* Effective interaction in cross-functional and cross-cultural teams, promoting collaboration, communication, and being a team player, reflects collaborative skills.
* Inspirational communicator, capable of effectively conveying ideas, inspiring teams, and fostering a collaborative environment.
* Independent and self-reliant, demonstrating the ability to take initiative and drive projects forward, signifies Independence and Initiative.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours, set direction, make things happen and one DeLaval. We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

 The position is based in EMEA and global travelling will be part of this role.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If you're ready to take on a rewarding role in driving the successful implementation of DeLaval Plus services, we invite you to join as our Implementation Manager. Apply now and be a key player in shaping the future of digital innovation within our organization! Attach your resume and cover letter, when applying through our career page. Please note that we do not accept any applications via email.
   

  

 For questions about the role please feel free reach out to hiring manager René Kolbach (rene.kolbach@delaval.com).
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,700 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Business Developer - Swedish Speaking
description:
**Business Developer – Leyton Sverige**
**Om Leyton Sweden:** 
 Leyton Sverige är en del av Leyton Group och etablerades 2021 i Sverige. Vi är specialiserade på att hjälpa innovativa och tillverkande företag att få tillgång till finansiering för att utveckla sina verksamheter och behålla sin konkurrenskraft. Genom våra högkvalitativa finansiella konsulttjänster gör vi en verklig skillnad för både våra kunder och Sveriges ekonomi.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?** 
 På Leyton hjälper vi företag att optimera sina kostnader och öka sina besparingar genom innovativa finansiella lösningar. Våra tjänster är anpassade för att stödja deras tillväxt och utveckling. Med vår unika success fee -modell betalar kunden endast om de faktiskt gör extra besparingar. Vi tar inga förskottsavgifter eller kräver att budgetar ska planeras i förväg – vårt mål är att alla potentiella kunder ska kunna ta del av våra tjänster utan risk.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen som Business Developer?**
 Som Business Developer hos oss har du en nyckelroll i att driva företagets tillväxt. Du kommer att:
   

  

* Ringa och boka möten med C-level-chefer inom en rad olika branscher.
* Delta i möten och kvalificera potentiella kunder.
* Stänga affärer och skapa långvariga kundrelationer.
* Ansvara för att hålla CRM-systemet uppdaterat.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är driven av att nå mål och överträffa förväntningar.
* Trivs med att arbeta i en prestationsbaserad miljö där du har stor påverkan på din egen lön.
* Har en stark vilja att utvecklas och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Gillar utmaningar och att kliva utanför din komfortzon.
* Är nyfiken och vill vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa.


**Varför ska du inte söka denna tjänst?**
* Om du ogillar att arbeta mot uppsatta mål och deadlines.
* Om du inte är intresserad av att utvecklas och ta till dig feedback.
* Om du föredrar en statisk arbetsmiljö och vill hålla dig inom din komfortzon.


**Varför ska du söka denna tjänst?**
* Om du vill sälja en tjänst som verkligen gör skillnad för företag och samhället.
* Om du tror att det är enkelt att sälja tjänster som i praktiken är "gratis" för kunden.
* Om du älskar känslan av att skriva under avtal och stänga affärer.
* Om du vill utveckla dina försäljningsfärdigheter och få direkt påverkan på din lön genom en attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.


**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att växa.
* En attraktiv provisionsmodell utan tak.
* Stora utvecklingsmöjligheter inom försäljning och affärsutveckling.
* Möjligheten att påverka både företagets och din egen framgång.
* Teamkänsla där du är en del av ett företag som uppskattar och belönar dina prestationer.
* 30 dagars semester, privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och pensionsförmåner.


**Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär? Sluta läsa och kom väx med oss!**
