* Dokumenterad erfarenhet inom säkerhetsskydd och informationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av att planera och implementera övergångar till nya IT-system och övergångar till nya arbetssätt/processer
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Svenskt medborgarskap


 Meriterande
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom Försvarsmakten eller annan statlig myndighet med projekt-/förvaltningledning
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med verksamhetsledning, teknisk koordinering, driftledning eller logistikhantering
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda stora team
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av transformationsprojekt i komplexa miljöer med höga säkerhetskrav
* B-körkort


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Som person är du driven, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad, har förmåga att arbeta som en del i en grupp men också självständigt. Du har stort intresse för verksamhetsnytta och verksamhetsutveckling. Du är kvalitetsmedveten och positiv, förstår skillnaden mellan kortsiktiga och långsiktiga lösningar, nuläge och önskat läge.
   

  

 Du trivs med att arbeta i en komplex verksamhet under ständing utveckling och tillväxt och du har ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande. Dina värderingar stämmer överens med Försvarsmaktens värdegrund och profession. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Övrigt
   

  

 Befattningen är tillsvidare och inleds med 6 månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten. Placeringsort är Stockholm och tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Resor i tjänsten förekommer. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV samt ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-08-17. För eventuella frågor om rekryteringsprocessen maila HR, stina.bengtsson@mil.se
   

  

**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Försvarsmaktens telekommunikations- och informationssystemförband, FMTIS, säkerställer Försvarsmaktens förmåga att kommunicera och leda - dygnet runt, året om. Förbandet har ett samlat ansvar för Försvarsmaktens tekniska ledningssystem som stödjer militära insatser till sjöss, på land och i luften – i Sverige och utomlands. Förbandet har över 1 800 medarbetare på mer än 30 orter runt om i landet. Läs mer på https://jobb.forsvarsmakten.se/fmtis En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras samt att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Azure DevOps Consultant – Contract Assignment
description:
**Uppdrag: Erfaren Tech Lead inom IT-transformation (Retail)**
 Vi söker nu en tekniskt kunnig och strategiskt orienterad Tech Lead till ett omfattande förändringsinitiativ inom sortiment och inköp. Detta är en nyckelroll där du blir länken mellan IT och verksamhet och ansvarar för att driva tekniska leveranser i ett affärskritiskt område.
   

  

**Om uppdraget**
 Verksamheten genomgår en omfattande omställning som kräver nära samverkan mellan affär och IT. Som Tech Lead kommer du att axla ett helhetsansvar för teknikspåret inom ett specifikt beslutsområde, med mandat att leda, prioritera och styra de tekniska insatserna på ett effektivt och affärsnära sätt.
   

  

 Du agerar sammanhållande kraft för tekniska leveranser, sätter riktning inom berörda domäner och säkerställer rätt kompetens och resurser vid behov. En viktig del i rollen är att fungera som brygga mellan teknik och affär, där du samarbetar med arkitekter och andra nyckelroller för att säkra långsiktigt hållbara lösningar.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Leda teknisk planering, strategiarbete och framtagning av roadmap
* Koordinera tekniska insatser och prioritera utifrån affärsstrategi och effekt
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet, stabilitet och kostnadseffektivitet i tekniska lösningar
* Hantera kommunikation med stakeholders och tydliggöra innehåll i roadmap
* Aktivt undanröja hinder för att stötta framdrift i projekt och leveranser


**Profil och kompetens**
 För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du är en erfaren ledare med teknisk förståelse, analytisk skärpa och förmåga att navigera i komplexa förändringsmiljöer. Du är en självgående do:er som gärna kliver in och tar ansvar, både strategiskt och operativt.
   

  

**Krav**
* Gedigen bakgrund inom IT och teknisk leverans
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av ledarskap, t.ex. som uppdragsledare, projektledare eller chef
* Erfarenhet från detaljhandelsbranschen (retail)
* Har drivit eller deltagit i större transformationsprojekt


**Meriterande Erfarenhet**
* Arbetat med sortimentsplanering och systemstöd inom detta område, exempelvis Blue Yonder
* Insikter inom dataanalys kopplat till sortiment och inköp
* Förståelse för hur AI kan användas i framtida sortimentsarbete
* Erfarenhet av strategiarbete kopplat till IT och affärsutveckling


**Uppdragsinformation**
* Start: 5 maj 2025
* Slut: 31 december 2025
* Omfattning: Heltid
* Plats: Stockholm
* Språk: Svenska och engelska krävs i både tal och skrift


**Ansökan**
 Vi tillämpar löpande urval – skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt med:
   

  

* Uppdaterat CV
* Timpris (inkl. eventuella omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsinformation
* Kort motivering där du visar hur du matchar uppdraget, gärna med exempel på 1–2 tidigare uppdrag med liknande innehåll


**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: IT Architect – Energy Business
description:
Are you ready to take on the challenge of shaping the future of energy assets? As an IT Architect - at Vattenfall, you will play a pivotal role in driving our mission of achieving fossil free living within one generation. By optimizing and innovating our IT landscape, you will contribute to increasing efficiency and sustainably. Your expertise will contribute to a smarter, more resilient energy system, making a real impact on the environment.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 You will become part of a central and internationally operating IT hub of IT Architects, where each individual has a focus on a specific part of our energy business. You will play a crucial role in steering our strategic projects to successful execution through fit-for-purpose architecture. Your responsibilities will include consulting, supporting and educating the business on IT, integration, and data strategies. With your solid understanding of IT security, you will support our mission critical environment in the evolving and changing business we are operating in. You will build up business knowledge to become the go-to expert for advancing our IT landscape.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Guide strategic projects to successful execution with fit-for-purpose architecture
* Consult and educate the business on IT, integration, and data strategies
* Support in adopting secure IT practices
* Drive the adoption of data mesh in collaboration with the business
* Help grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles
* Act as a trusted advisor, enabling operating models through technology, even if it requires radical change


 By fostering strong interactions with internal and external stakeholders, you will help shape the future of our IT landscape. Your ability to translate complex challenges into actionable insights will inspire your colleagues and drive the continuous improvement of our operations.
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Who are you
   

  

 You are an experienced professional with a strong background in IT architecture, ideally with a business focus on asset-intensive industries such as Energy, Water, Industry, or Automotive. With at least 10+ years of relevant experience, you bring a deep understanding of IT security, integration topics, and data strategies. Your academic degree in IT or a related field has equipped you with the theoretical knowledge, while your practical experience has honed your skills in implementing fit-for-purpose architectures.
   

  

 You have successfully navigated the complexities of international environments. Your ability to communicate effectively with both IT and non-IT colleagues at various levels within the organization sets you apart. You thrive in dynamic, ever-changing environments and are adept at translating complex problems into actionable insights for the Management Board.
   

  

**Key Qualifications We Are Looking For**
* Extensive experience as an Architect or Consultant
* Deep IT knowledge and experience with IT architecture and frameworks
* Comfortable communicating complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Ability to thrive in an ever-changing environment and direct complex problems into concise actions for leadership


 Your ability to build trust and drive change will be essential in this role, as you help shape the future of our business through innovative IT solutions.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

 Join us in Luleå or Stockholm and become part of a team dedicated to creating fossil-free energy within one generation. Enjoy a challenging, international work environment, a central office location with easy access to public transport, and a healthy work-life balance. Submit your application, including your CV, in English via our website. For more information, contact Folmer Koper via folmer1.koper@vattenfall.com. At Vattenfall, we value diversity and welcome all applicants.

title: Chief Product Owner Oracle Database Services
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Engineering
company_industry: Banking and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Do you have a passion and understanding of IT Infrastructure, want to transform and modernize Oracle Database area and be part of and customer centric and highly automated delivery of Infrastructure services?
   

  

 As Chief Product Owner, you will own and drive the transformation of Oracle Database services together with other IT Infrastructure areas, deciding and executing on long term strategy and ensuring smooth day to day operations with customer always in mind.
   

  

 With us you will have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Define and execute the strategic vision for Oracle Database platforms, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture and regulatory standards
* Lead and participate in various modernization and strategic initiatives involving deliveries from area
* Manage full budget of area, including staffing, tooling, hardware and software subscriptions
* Manage relationship with external suppliers in respective area of responsibility, ensuring good support and adequate deliveries
* Empower Agile Product Owners and teams to deliver high-quality solutions and continuously improve
* Lead multi-national team located 4 different countries – Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania and Sweden
* Build and develop a high-performing, T-shaped team with the right skills to meet current and future demands


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field
* Solid experience and knowledge of various Oracle Databases, solutions and products supporting it
* Experience in leading transformation initiatives
* Proven leadership experience in managing cross-functional teams and mentoring other leaders
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage stakeholders at all levels


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 as your future manager, I bring trust in people, teams and encourage collaborative environment with clear focus on goals and important deliveries. I expect to have open climate, dialogue and continuous feedback culture. If you are open minded, goal oriented and want to define and contribute to joint goals and grow in high-performing environment, my team is place to b!"
 **Ingus Pelčers, your future manager.**
 We look forward to your application by 28.08.2025. the latest.

title: Teknisk säljare till Measurement & Analytics
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.
   

  

 This Position reports to:
   

  

 Sales Manager
   

  

**Roll och ansvarsområden**
 ABB Measurement & Analytics söker nu en strategisk och resultatorienterad säljare för att driva försäljningen inom produktområdet Gasanalys mot energi- och industrikunder på den svenska marknaden. Du blir en del av ABB Measurement & Analytics, en division inom affärsområdet Process Automation. Vårt fokus är att göra installation, användning och underhåll av instrument och analysatorer så enkelt som möjligt.
   

  

 Du får stor frihet under ansvar i rollen och har möjlighet att påverka både dina arbetsuppgifter och din utveckling. Här får du arbeta med den senaste tekniken i ett kompetent och engagerat team. Rollen innebär frekventa resor, med stort fokus på att bygga starka kundrelationer och förstå kundernas behov direkt på plats. Placeringen är flexibel – du kan utgå från ditt hem, så länge du har goda pendlingsmöjligheter till områden mellan Göteborg och Stockholm.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Som säljare hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att driva och utveckla affärer inom svensk industri, med fokus på branscher som papper & massa samt energisektorn. Du identifierar nya affärsmöjligheter, bygger starka relationer och ser till att både befintliga och nya kunder får innovativa lösningar som skapar värde.
* Du arbetar strategiskt och proaktivt med hög aktivitetsnivå för att maximera kundupplevelsen och säkerställa långsiktiga affärsrelationer.
* Genom att utveckla och genomföra säljaktiviteter enligt vår säljplan, samarbetar du nära våra Account Teams och lokala business centers för att hitta nya vägar till framgång och leverera skräddarsydda lösningar till våra kunder.
* Du äger säljprocessen från första kontakt till avslut, med stöd av våra tekniska säljspecialister och produktchefer. Här får du frihet att ta egna initiativ, samtidigt som du har ett starkt team i ryggen.


**Din bakgrund**
* Du har en teknisk utbildning i grunden och ett starkt intresse för teknik.
* Du har flerårig erfarenhet inom analysteknik.
* Du trivs i kundmöten och har en tydlig kommersiell profil.
* Du har erfarenhet av CRM-system och moderna IT-verktyg.
* Du är strategisk, relationsskapande och skicklig på att navigera inom kunders organisationer.
* Ditt driv och affärssinne kommer tillsammans med din kreativitet vara viktiga framgångsfaktorer.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Det här erbjuder vi dig**
 Vi uppmuntrar dig till att ta initiativ, våga utmana idéer och driva ditt arbete framåt. Här växer du genom meningsfullt arbete och livslångt lärande, där vi stöttar dig längs vägen. Varje idé du delar och varje steg du tar bidrar till något större.
   

  

**Mer om oss**
 Rekryterande chef Mikael Gustavsson +46 724 644 770 svarar gärna på dina frågor kring tjänsten. Fackliga kontaktpersoner: Sveriges Ingenjörer - Jannica Åhman, +46 701 84 31 63, Unionen - Krista Andersson, +4621-34 02 86, Ledarna - Kenneth Wahlqvist, +46 706 52 09 67. Övriga frågor ställs till Talent Partner Irma Leijon, +46 724 612 314.
   

  

 Du är välkommen med din ansökan senast 11 augusti 2025. Vänligen notera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Juli är semestermånad i Sverige, och på ABB tar vi till vara på möjligheten att ladda batterierna. Vi tror på vikten av återhämtning och balans i livet. Det innebär att rekryteringsprocessen kan gå något långsammare – vi hoppas på din förståelse och uppskattar ditt tålamod!
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Business Development Senior Manager, Border Management
description:
**Overview**
**WELCOME TO** 
**SITA**
 We're the team that keeps airports moving, airlines flying smoothly, and borders open. Our tech and communication innovations are the secret behind the success of the world’s air travel industry.
   

  

 You'll find us at 95% of international hubs. We partner closely with over 2,500 transportation and government clients, each with their own unique needs and challenges. Our goal is to find fresh solutions and cutting-edge tech to make their operations run like clockwork. Want to be a part of something big?
   

  

 Are you ready to love your job? The adventure begins right here, with you, at SITA.
   

  

**About The Role And Team**
 This role is available in multiple locations across Europe, including
 **Tallinn, Brussels, Stockholm, Rotterdam, and Prague.**
 As a Business Development Senior Manager, you will play a pivotal role in expanding SITA’s Border Management footprint across Europe. You will lead generating new government-focused business, by identifying opportunities, initiating contact with key stakeholders, and driving complex sales cycles to close.
   

  

 This role is critical to enabling Border Management’s strategic growth by fostering long-term relationships with public sector entities, navigating procurement and RFP processes, and unlocking new revenue streams. To succeed, you will need a hunter mindset, consultative selling abilities, and the strategic capability to align our offering with government needs and regulatory environments.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities with government and public agencies across Europe.
* Generate and nurture contacts through creative prospecting approaches, including cold outreach, networking, and attending conferences.
* Develop and manage a pipeline of qualified leads from first contact to deal closure.
* Articulate SITA’s value proposition and tailor messaging to address the specific pain points and strategic goals of government clients.
* Lead the engagement in RFPs and government tenders, driving and coordinating internal teams to shape compelling proposals.
* Build and maintain trusted relationships with government stakeholders at both technical and executive levels.
* Accurately manage all sales activities and forecasts using Salesforce or similar CRM platforms.
* Represent SITA at industry events to elevate our brand and identify emerging opportunities.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, legal, and marketing teams to deliver tailored solutions.
* Maintain momentum through long, complex sales cycles with a strong sense of ownership and drive.


**Qualifications**
**ABOUT YOUR SKILLS**
* Experience in business development, sales, or strategic account management, preferably in government technology, border management, public safety, or similar business experience in the public sector.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, International Relations, Political Science, , Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience working in or with public sector organizations (e.g., ministries of interior, immigration or border control agencies, security services). Knowledge of government structures, procurement policies, especially in European markets.
* Proven track record of winning or working on complex deals in highly regulated, government-led procurement environments including RFPs and tenders.
* Ability to penetrate new markets by establishing contact with previously untapped government agencies.
* A hunter mindset with ability of identifying high-value opportunities and turning cold leads into strategic wins.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and starting from scratch using persistence, research, and creative strategies to open doors in new territories.
* Ability to collaborate cross functionally with commercial, product, and legal teams to align offers with both customer requirements and internal strategy.
* High level of English fluency in both written and verbal communication.


**NICE-TO-HAVE**
* Existing network of government contacts across Europe, particularly in border security, immigration, or homeland defense agencies.
* Prior experience in identity management, biometrics, or national security programs.


**What We Offer**
 We’re all about diversity. We operate in 200 countries and speak 60 different languages and cultures. We’re really proud of our inclusive environment. Our offices are comfortable and fun places to work, and we make sure you get to work from home too. Find out what it's like to join our team and take a step closer to your best life ever.
   

  

 🏡
 **Flex Week:** 
 Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your location)
   

  

 ⏰
 **Flex Day:** 
 Make your workday suit your life and plans.
   

  

 🌎
 **Flex Location:** 
 Take up to 30 days a year to work from any location in the world.
   

  

 🌿
 **Employee Wellbeing:** 
 We’ve got you covered with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), for you and your dependents 24/7, 365 days/year. We also offer Champion Health - a personalized platform that supports a range of wellbeing needs.
   

  

 🚀
 **Professional Development** 
 : Level up your skills with our training platforms, including LinkedIn Learning!
   

  

**🙌🏽 Competitive Benefits** 
 : Competitive benefits that make sense with both your local market and employment status.
   

  

*SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, we encourage women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities to apply and self-identify in the application process.*

title: Security Strategist (EMEA North)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Security Specialist (EMEA North)**
*Open to locations in Sweden, Norway, Denmark or Finland*
 Splunk is here to build a safer and more resilient digital world. The world's leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. While customers love our technology, it's our people that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination and why we've won so many awards as a best place to work. If you become a Splunker, we want your whole, authentic self, what we call your "million data points". So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you vary. We look at talent, values and character when hiring.
   

  

 Role summary
   

  

 Your primary focus as a Security Strategist is on what's new and what’s next to stay ahead of customer, market and technology trends. You will be part of a small team of technical and domain security subject matter experts that will identify and incubate emerging and strategic Security use cases and solutions that will unify, advance and expand the value of Splunk products for our EMEA North customers with an increased focus on the Nordics region. You will work closely with theater partners, but report up through the Global organization. You will be responsible for driving adoption and success metrics for emerging and incubation-stage security use cases and solutions for your assigned theater and region, while also fulfilling global responsibilities to help evangelize and advance the Splunk Security brand, product and GTM strategy.
   

  

 Your role will require you to interface cross-functionally at both theater and global levels with teams across sales, technical sales, customer success, partners, product marketing and product management.
   

  

 What you'll get to do!
   

  

* Develop and refine emerging security use cases for Splunk products that reflect priority customer challenges, market trends, the evolving threat landscape and unique business opportunities.
* Develop and test new maturity models, white papers, programs, workshops, demos, POVs, enablement content, and thought leadership content to showcase and accelerate adoption of emerging information security use cases and solutions.
* Represent Splunk Security internally as a security GTM stakeholder in product roadmap, launch planning, customer initiative development in strategic growth areas for our customers and our business in security.
* Evangelize Splunk Security vision, strategy and roadmap at industry events and with global customers and partners.
* Mentor security talent both within our team and across the SE and Solution Architect community at Splunk as we look to continue to increase and expand the profile of security.
* Partner with regional teams to localize global content and strategy to region-specific sales plays, enablement content, account targeting strategies and channel strategies for incubation-stage use cases and solutions with the in-theater technical sales and sales teams.


**Qualifications**
* 7+ years of technical sales, product or practitioner experience in the security industry.
* Experience with modern security technologies and their place in an organization's architecture, e.g., SIEM, SOAR, and UEBA.
* Clear and concise communicator being comfortable presenting publicly to large audiences or one on one with senior executives.
* Experience in driving complex security sales cycles across EMEA.
* Demonstrated knowledge of current threats, high-visibility security events, and trends in the marketplace.
* Familiarity with current security data sources spanning on-premises, hybrid, & multi-cloud (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) including the security detection methodologies they offer.
* Familiarity with common industry frameworks and concepts like MITRE ATT&CK, CSC CIS, LMKC, OTel, DORA, etc.
* Willingness and ability to work cross-functionally across a globally-dispersed remote organization with minimal supervision.
* Willingness to travel for industry and marketing events, customer and functional meetings.
* Based in Sweden, Denmark or Norway.


 Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.
   

  

 Note

title: Sales Advisor 5h - temporary contract
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a Sales Advisor at H&M, you’ll play a key role in creating an outstanding customer experience. You’ll welcome customers, guide them through your store, and support them in finding what they need while showcasing our products. Acting in line with our values, you’ll contribute to both your own success and the success of the company.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Share your fashion and product knowledge to help customers make informed choices.
* Collaborate with your team to deliver exceptional service at every step of the customer journey.
* Ensure the sales floor and back of house are well-stocked, organized, and inviting.
* Support with opening and closing of the store.
* Represent yourself and the brand positively during all customer interactions.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Our stores are the heart of our company, where customers experience our brand firsthand. As part of the dynamic Store Team, every role—from Sales Advisors, Department Managers, Store Managers and Visual Merchandisers to Assistant Store Managers, Cash Office Responsible, and Delivery Responsible in larger stores—contributes to creating an inspiring and welcoming environment. You’ll also connect with the wider Area Team, collaborating across stores to share insights and drive success together. Alongside your team, you'll play a vital role in helping customers feel confident and express their individuality with the latest trends and timeless styles. By building meaningful connections with customers in our stores, we make fashion accessible and sustainable for all.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Experience in customer service within fashion, retail, or similar fields.


*And people who are…*
* Passionate about fashion and delivering an exceptional in-store experience while promoting our products and driving sales.
* Thriving in collaborative and dynamic environments.
* Communicative, creative, curious to work with store technology, with a strong eagerness to learn and develop.
* Flexible and action oriented.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

**This is a temporary position for 4 months offering 5 hours per week with start in September or by agreement.** 
**This position is based in Upplands Väsby** 
 and you should be able to work during store opening hours. Language skills in Swedish or English is needed.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection, so the position may be filled before the application deadline, so send in your application today!
 **The last application date is 14/8.**
 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* Store roles assessment:


*To manage the high volume of applications for the Sales Advisor role, we use an online assessment method for skills-based recruitment within some of our stores. You will need to complete it as part of the application and screening process. Your responses will be scored by an assessment tool that applies predefined criteria set by H&M Group.* 
***Please look out for an email in your inbox/junk email from MAKI.***
*After completing the assessment, you’ll have the opportunity to share feedback and ask questions. If you experience any difficulties or prefer an alternative assessment method, please contact* 
*recruitment\_support@hm.com* 
*. Choosing an alternative will not impact on your application.*
*For more information on how we process your personal data, please see our Privacy Notice.*
* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Project Manager - Due Diligence (Saas)
description:
Are you ready to simplify complex due diligence processes and drive impactful change? Do you enjoy working hands on with systems and want to take your purchasing skills into action in a fast-paced SaaS-company? Then this might be your next role. We are now looking for a Project Manager with strong procurement experience to join our Product Services & Solutions Sustainability team in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.
 



  





 At Stratsys, we offer a SaaS platform that simplifies compliance and due diligence across regulations like CSDDD, NIS2 and other evolving EU directives. Our tools help companies move from risk identification to action, enabling proactive supplier transparency, risk mitigation and regulatory alignment.
 



  





 In this role, you will onboard customers, train them in our platform and tailor the configuration to fit their needs. This way, your work will directly contribute to helping our customers meet upcoming EU regulations and reduce supplier-related risks – a business-critical area for many organizations. You will make sure they adopt and gain full value from our tools. Who said compliance can't be fun?
 



  





**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡** 



* You will be a part of a high-energy and collaborative culture where colleagues become friends. Take a look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture
* Work from a fantastic and central office in A House the Ark in Stockholm or at Kungsportplatsen in Gothenburg
* Maximum wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 and a company that encourages exercise and movement
* Work in a really important area with significant potential and strong market demand. The sustainability field is a growth area for us where you will have fast-paced working days with a lot of varied tasks.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!



  





**About The Role 📌** 




 As a Project Manager, your focus is to lead implementations of our SaaS platform in the due diligence space. You’ll spend a good portion of your week inside our platform – configuring workflows, testing supplier forms and guiding customers through best practice setups. You will work closely with sourcing teams at large organizations to ensure the solution fits into their processes and delivers real value.
 



 You will also collaborate across product, sales and customer success. While this is not a sales role, we value your curiosity in identifying customer needs. Your procurement knowledge can make a real difference in complex cases, and you may support sales dialogues where your insights help shape the right offering.
 



  





**Amongst other tasks - the responsibilities include;** 



* Leading onboarding projects for new and existing customers.
* Independently conduct product training for customers, both online and in person, to help customers master the product.
* Configuring the product to match customer needs and processes. This involves hands-on work in our platform, so you’ll need to be comfortable with technical systems and enjoy solving logical challenges.
* Consult the customer on how the products best fit with their processes and how to get full value out of the products.
* Lead and motivate the customer's project team through the implementation.
* Capture and follow up on the customer's further needs within our product offering to contribute to additional sales with our customers.
* Collaborating with internal teams like Customer Success to ensure the best possible outcome for the customer.



  





**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️** 



* University degree in a relevant field
* At least three years of experience in purchasing or supply chain at a larger organization
* Deep understanding of procurement processes and due diligence requirements
* Interest in digital tools and willingness to work hands on with system implementation
* Experience leading projects and collaborating with various stakeholders
* Fluent in Swedish with strong English skills



  





**Nice-to-haves** 



* Experience with SaaS, consulting or system implementation in a procurement context
* Background in sustainability or supply chain
* Familiarity with regulations such as CSDDD, NIS2 EUDR, CBAM, DORA or Åpenhetsloven
* Educational background in procurement or supply chain
* Proficiency in German or Norwegian



  





**About You 👀** 




 You are a structured and pragmatic problem solver who enjoys seeing things move forward. You take ownership, drive progress and are comfortable navigating complexity together with others. You are curious and proactive, with a genuine interest in how digital tools can support better procurement practices. While you bring your own experience, you are humble in your approach and eager to learn from others.
 



 You collaborate naturally across teams and levels and know how to adapt your communication depending on the audience. You feel confident leading customers and workshops, and you thrive in a role where you are close to both people and product.
 



  





**About Us 🚀** 




 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you - Show your interest for future openings by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Facebook.

title: Senior Consultant (f/m/d) People & Organization Strategic Projects
description:
Our ambition as People and Organization (P&O) function is to co-own the overall Siemens transformation, enabling Siemens’ businesses to remain successful in an ever faster changing environment. Accordingly, our global P&O leadership team has recently set our new P&O Strategy 2030 and is reviewing P&O’s strategic priorities regularly. In this context, we are further expanding our recently established Strategic Projects team to contribute to the end-to-end deployment of the strategy and provide our businesses with the capabilities and capacities needed.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Engage in high-visibility projects in an international environment providing you with the chance to broaden your network across Siemens
* Contribute to the design of our brand-new unit and make your unique mark
* Be an integral part of Siemens’ transformation journey, directly creating impact and accompanying implementation
* Be a member of a new highly diverse team intended to incubate people for Siemens with broad personal growth perspectives by living your passion for people & organization
* 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard


 Since each of over 300,000 team members feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here.
   

  

 The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, local or corporate conditions.
   

  

**What role will you play:**
 As a Senior Consultant (f/m/d) for Strategic P&O Projects, you will play a crucial role in driving P&O's key strategic priorities alongside responsible P&O professionals and business colleagues.
   

  

 In particular, you will…
   

  

* set-up, structure, and steer multiple modules in the execution of complex and high-visibility P&O projects on an international scale. This will give you the opportunity to quickly expand your network across Siemens
* jointly with the accountable P&O experts and the businesses shape the P&O solution landscape and drive the deployment of our P&O Strategy 2030
* join forces with our global P&O business partners and P&O country heads to implement strategic projects generating impact and drive positive change
* be a change agent, think end-to-end, challenge, hypothesize, test & build innovative solutions ensuring effective implementation from the start
* orchestrate the ecosystem of key stakeholders incl. business, P&O, and contributors/ service providers
* connect the dots and enable your colleagues to identify and address interdependencies with other ongoing strategic P&O efforts
* leverage data to design all efforts for maximum user impact, striving to make valuable contributions to Siemens holistically
* offer a fresh perspective by introducing new ways of working and are open to experiment, e.g., agile-inspired approaches
* contribute to shaping our team, managed in Squads and Chapters, within the Siemens P&O function


**What we expect:**
* Experience & Skills
+ You have an excellent academic background (Master’s Degree or equivalent experience)
+ You bring extensive professional experience from leading management consulting companies – with a focus on P&O / HR topics and preferably in Siemens-related industries as well as additional HR related experience
+ You possess outstanding analytical, communication and stakeholder management skills. You demonstrate the dynamics of a large organization and use smart influencing to effectuate change
+ In addition, you have a sound and broad P&O / HR domain know-how, e.g. acquired in a HR Business Partner or HR CoE / Expert role (i.e., learning, talent management, organizational excellence, mergers & acquisitions, skill management, HR tool landscape / digitalization, change concepts) – we know, nobody has it all :-)
+ You ideally also bring eperience with AI use cases in the context of P&O projects

* Ways of working
+ You are a fast learner, eager to understand in depth and apply the relevant concepts and tools, and committed to comprehensive optimization
+ You have an entrepreneurial “can do” attitude and are excited to shape this team

* Languages
+ Proficiency in English


 You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!
   

  

 Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities. In the case of equal qualifications, severely disabled applicants and applicants with equivalent status will be given preference.
   

  

**About Us**
 We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. That’s why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we’ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
DLL is seeking a strategic and results-driven Senior Account Manager to join our LifeTech team in Sweden. LifeTech covers the Workplace, Technology, and Healthcare sectors. You will be supporting growth across these sectors. We offer B2B financing solutions that enable our partners to deliver complete, value-added packages to their professional customers.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for managing and expanding relationships with key partners, supporting them in offering financing for a wide range of equipment, from laptops and copiers to CT scanners and entire data centres. You will drive both account development and new business acquisition, with a strong focus on structuring complex, high-value deals that require customized solutions and cross-functional collaboration.
   

  

 Success in this role demands a consultative approach, commercial acumen, and the ability to navigate intricate deal structures through DLL’s internal approval processes. You’ll work closely with departments such as credit, legal and risk to ensure alignment and timely execution, while maintaining a high standard of service for our partners.
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL
   

  

 Day to day
   

  

* Develop and strengthen relationships with local suppliers and global vendors in the LifeTech market
* Identify and formalize new partnerships through strategic agreements
* Structure and negotiate tailored financing solutions, including non-standard transactions
* Lead internal alignment across credit, legal, and risk teams to secure approvals for complex deals
* Create and maintain account plans, forecasts, and pipeline management
* Train partner sales teams on financing tools and value propositions
* Support partner-led customer meetings to secure financing agreements
* Build and maintain a strong internal network to support business objectives and respond to external developments


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Check this link to an overview of all benefits in your region.


 “We not only live up to the expectations of our customers for today, but also anticipate their market needs of tomorrow.”
   

  

 Essentials
   

  

 You are a commercially driven professional with a consultative mindset and a proven ability to manage complex B2B sales processes. You thrive in environments that require strategic thinking, stakeholder management, and solution-based selling.
   

  

* Demonstrated experience in managing complex sales involving multiple internal stakeholders
* Strong financial acumen, including the ability to interpret financial statements and assess risk
* Skilled in contract negotiation and structuring bespoke solutions
* Background in financial services, leasing, insurance, software, or IT equipment is preferred
* University degree (Bachelor’s or higher)
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


 This position is based in Stockholm, with close collaboration across DLL’s commercial and support teams. If you’re ready to make an impact in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL
   

  

 Settling in
   

  

 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.
   

  

 But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and a honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.
   

  

 We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world**
 Good to know
   

  

* Deadline for application: August 17th (application deadline may close sooner if a high number of applications are received)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #IND123
* For more information or additional questions, you are welcome to contact our Talent Acquisition Partner Joep Staps via joep.staps@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: FAE Electromechanical Hardware
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
company_industry: Retail Appliances, Electrical, and Electronic Equipment
description:
**About Us**
**DISCOVER RADIALL**
 Since 1952, we have been designing and manufacturing cutting-edge technologies for some of the world's most demanding applications.
   

  

 From space exploration to communication to aviation, our international teams are working to create interconnect components that power the future. Our sites are located in different countries, including France, Italy, United-States, China, Mexico and India. At the heart of our factories, we grow industrial know-how including molding, plating and component assembly.
   

  

 We are a community of more than 3,000 employees, rich in diversity, with a strong team spirit and open to all of those around us. Dare to be audacious, Make it Simple, Be genuine and Grow together are the 4 values guiding our actions every day.
   

  

 At Radiall, we have made a choice: "Creating connections that matter". This is how we expressed our purpose, which invites us to work for a better world, through topics that we have identified and on which we can act.
   

  

**Mission**
**YOUR MISSION**
 As a Field Application Engineer (FAE)
 **Electromechanical Hardware** 
 , you act as a trusted technical advisor, bringing in-depth knowledge of Radiall’s solutions and their applications. Your mission: analyze customer needs, provide technical guidance, and coordinate internal and external stakeholders to deliver effective and profitable solutions.
   

  

 You will be the key interface between customers and Radiall teams (Engineering, Sales, Manufacturing, Quality), ensuring alignment across all aspects of the project lifecycle.
   

  

**Key Activities Include**
* Develop and maintain strong technical relationships with strategic customers.
* Lead pre-sales technical discussions, define customer requirements, and negotiate technical aspects including compliance matrices, datasheets, and qualification plans.
* Prepare technical specifications and draft PENs for complex products or sub-systems.
* Deliver product demonstrations and presentations tailored to customer needs and sales efforts.
* Collaborate with the Sales team to assess opportunities, define strategy, and execute acquisition plans.
* Coordinate product evaluations, pricing strategies, and performance expectations.
* Support the Quality team in resolving product-related performance issues.
* Identify opportunities for expanding the product portfolio.
* Validate technical and commercial offers in the context of new developments or PENs.
* Translate customer expectations into actionable steps to ensure high-quality service and support.
* Ensure fast and effective resolution of customer concerns.


**Profile**
**PROFILE**
 You have a solid engineering background and extensive experience in technical-commercial roles. Your mindset, language skills, and global readiness make you a valuable asset for a high-impact position.
   

  

 Education & Experience
   

  

* Engineering Degree (or equivalent)
* Minimum 15 years of experience in a technical-commercial environment
* Strong technical foundation in RF board-to-board applications


 Skills & Mindset
   

  

* High level of autonomy – capable of operating independently
* Proactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of initiative
* Entrepreneurial spirit and solid business mindset
* Ability to challenge and support both internal teams and customers constructively
* Comfortable navigating remote management structures
* Effective in international and multicultural environments


 Mobility & Availability
   

  

* Willingness and flexibility to travel worldwide as needed


 Languages
   

  

* Fluent in English

title: Public Area Crew - Clarion Hotel Stockholm
description:
*About Clarion Hotel: Clarion Hotel® is not just a hotel chain; it's an immersive experience that combines Scandinavian hospitality with a touch of premium. Our team members are not merely employees; they are an integral part of the Clarion experience. We pride ourselves on delivering on personality, passion, and we always strive for perfection. Join us in shaping the future of hospitality! Clarion Hotel® is part of Strawberry.*
**Clarion Hotel Stockholm**
**Gör varje vistelse till ett mästerverk**
 På
 **Clarion Stockholm** 
 omdefinierar vi premiumgästfrihet med urban elegans, höga standarder och en atmosfär som är både livfull och välkomnande. Vi söker en Spastädare som förstår att varje oförglömlig vistelse börjar med ett fantastiskt första intryck och genomsyrar varje möte med gästerna.
   

  

 Som en del av vår
 **Public Area** 
 avdelning spelar du en avgörande roll i att säkerställa renlighet och gästnöjdhet. Din noggrannhet och omsorg i att hålla hotellet rent och inbjudande har en direkt påverkan på våra gästers upplevelse.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en engagerad medarbetare som vill bidra till avdelningens framgång.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Städning och underhåll av våra allmänna ytor, konferenytor, personalutrymmen och hotellområden - enligt högsta standard.
* Möblering
* Påfyllning av minibarer
* Se till att alla bekvämligheter är påfyllda och fungerar som de ska.
* Besvara gästförfrågningar och hantera eventuella problem snabbt och professionellt.
* Samarbeta med receptionen & housekeeping för att säkerställa en effektiv arbetsgång och hög kvalitet.
* Aktiv delta i avdelningsmöten och följa företagets policys och säkerhetsrutiner
* Bidra till avdelningens framgång inom gästnöjdhet, medarbetarnöjdhet och ekonomiska mål.


 Tjänsten är en
 **tillsvidare anställning på 50%** 
 , med tillträde omgående. Arbetstiderna varierar och innefattar kvällar och helger.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
* Du är omsorgsfull, nogrann och har ett öga för detaljer.
* Du arbetar strukturerat och med hög precision.
* Du är pålitlig, punktlig och har en positiv inställning.
* Du trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Du trivs med ett fysiskt aktivt arbete som innebär böjning, lyft och stående under längre perioder.
* Du inspireras av att vi är ett inkluderande team som värdesätter olikheter - vi har room for all och vi på Strawberry värdesätter mångfald. Olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och perspektiv skapar en inspirerande och dynamisk arbetsmiljö.


**Meriterande**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av städning av lokalvård, möblering eller housekeeping.
* Kunskap om rengöringsprodukter och tekniker.
* Ett proaktivt arbetssätt och viljan att gå den extra milen.


**Varför jobba på Clarion Hotel Stockholm & Strawberry?**
 På Clarion Är Du En Del Av En Hotellkedja Som Kombinerar Urban Stil Med Premiumkvalitet – Och Samma Engagemang Gäller För Våra Medarbetare. Här Är Några Av Förmånerna
   

  

* En arbetsplats med varm och stöttande kultur, hos oss vinner och förlorar vi som lag. Vi jobbar trots allt med samma vision - Att öka livskvalitén för gäster och kollegor
* En miljö som är ever changing - Hos oss är inte en dag lik en annan, vi har alltid någonting kul på gång
* Personalförmåner enligt Strawberrys policy som innefattar bland annat frinätter och rabatter på våra hotell och enheter
* Stora möjligheter att utvecklas inom en stor och expansivt hotellkoncern
* Friskvårdsbidrag


**Clarion** 
 är mer än bara ett hotell – det är en
 **kosmopolitisk destination** 
 . Med över 30 hotell i Norden förkroppsligar vi en modern, urban livsstil där kvalitet, gästfrihet och sofistikering går hand i hand. Våra centrala lägen och stilrena miljöer gör oss till den självklara platsen för en
 **urban upplevelse** 
 , oavsett om det gäller arbete eller nöje. Vi levererar
 **premiumservice dygnet runt** 
 .
   

  

**Om Strawberry**
**Strawberry** 
 är inte bara en hotellkedja – vi är en
 **revolution inom gästfrihet** 
 med ett varmt hjärta. Vi öppnar dörrar till en värld av
 **över 240 hotell, 120 restauranger och 20 spa** 
 , där vi skapar tusentals minnesvärda upplevelser varje dag. Våra tre kärnvärden
 **energi, mod och entusiasm** 
 genomsyrar allt vi gör. Med
 **20 000 medarbetare från över 166 länder** 
 fortsätter vi att växa och utvecklas.
   

  

**Redo att göra skillnad?**
 Om detta låter som du –
 **vänta inte, ansök idag!** 
 Hjälp oss att skapa premiumgästupplevelser på
 **Clarion** 
 . Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Account Manger - Life Science
description:
På ABB hjälper vi industrier att bli snabbare, mer resurseffektiva och hållbara. Här är framsteg en självklarhet - för dig, ditt team och hela världen. Som global marknadsledare ger vi dig rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas med det. Det kommer inte alltid att vara enkelt - utveckling kräver mod och styrka. På ABB är du aldrig ensam. Run what runs the world.
   

  

**Denna Position Rapporterar Till**
 Sales Manager
   

  

**Account Manager – Life Science**
**About Us**
 We are a diverse and experienced team with decades of expertise in building production processes for the pharmaceutical industry. Our engineers deliver state-of-the-art automation and digitalization solutions, tailored to meet the strict demands of pharmaceutical manufacturing.
   

  

 We work closely with our customers—not just as suppliers, but as true partners. Our team supports a global need in ABB for knowledge in building pharmaceutical production equipment. With offices in Malmö, Kista, and Västerås, we serve clients across Sweden and beyond. Our solutions are built on trusted ABB technologies, especially 800xA, which has supported the pharmaceutical industry for many years.
   

  

**Your Role:** 
 Are you passionate about shaping the future of Life Science solutions? We are looking for a driven and customer-focused Account Manager to strengthen our presence in the Life Science sector. You will work closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions in automation, digitalization, and sustainable technologies—always with a focus on regulatory compliance and quality.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm or Västerås
   

  

 Are you ready to shape the future of pharmaceutical manufacturing with cutting-edge automation and digitalization? At ABB Energy Industries, we are on a journey toward a more sustainable and digital world. We are now looking for an Account Manager – Life Science to help drive development and growth within the pharmaceutical sector.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 As an Account Manager – Life Science, you will:
   

  

* Manage key customer accounts where ABB has installed systems and solutions.
* Lead sales efforts for the modernization and expansion of existing automation and digitalization solutions.
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities, including greenfield factory setups and upgrades to production equipment.
* Act as the primary point of contact between customers and ABB, ensuring delivery of high-quality solutions with support from internal engineering teams.
* Build and maintain strong relationships at all levels of the customer organization, from executive leadership to production staff.
* Collaborate with ABB teams to deliver compliant solutions that meet pharmaceutical standards (e.g., GAMP 5, FDA 21 CFR Part 11, EU Annex 11).
* Support clients in achieving regulatory compliance in pharmaceutical production and other regulated environments.
* Represent ABB at industry events, seminars, and customer meetings.
* Assemble and lead internal capture teams to drive customer value and long-term partnerships.


**Qualifications**
* University degree in engineering or equivalent.
* Proven B2B sales experience, ideally within Life Science, pharmaceuticals, or medtech industries.
* Solid understanding of validated environments and applicable regulatory frameworks.
* Ability to communicate technical solutions in terms of customer value and business impact.
* Strong interpersonal skills with a natural ability to build long-term professional relationships.
* Results-driven, self-motivated, and customer-focused.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Swedish and English.
* Willingness to travel and possession of a valid B driver’s license.


**What’s In It For You**
 We empower you to take initiative, challenge ideas, and lead with confidence. You’ll grow through meaningful work, continuous learning, and support that’s tailored to your goals. Every idea you share and every action you take contributes to something bigger.
   

  

**More About Us**
 We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Please note that the interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process!
   

  

 Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.
   

  

 We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.
   

  

 Join us. Be part of the team where progress happens, industries transform, and your work shapes the world. Run What Runs the World.
   

  

 Recruiting Manager Magnus Högstedt, Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Torbjörn Eriksson, +46 702 08 99 50; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Hanna Norén, +46 706 34 03 46. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Sara Vestin, +46 724 64 46 88.
   

  

 We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter människor med olika bakgrund. Kan det här vara ditt nästa steg? Ansök idag eller besök www.abb.com för att läsa mer om oss och se hur vår teknologi påverkar världen.

description:

 to join our Sales team!
