title: Bid Manager (SaaS)
description:
Do you know procurement inside and out and are ready to take the lead in a fast-paced SaaS company? Look no further. We’re searching for a Bid Manager to join us in Stockholm or Gothenburg. You'll be the one who ensures that one of our most business-critical processes runs smoothly and efficiently.
 



 At Stratsys we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance in essential areas such as Sustainability, GRC, and Quality management, both in the public and private sector. Unlike other compliance tools, we go beyond reporting by helping organizations move into action and effectively distribute responsibility internally.
 



 Your mission? To keep our bids on track and moving forward. You’ll collaborate closely with sales, legal, partner teams and other stakeholders to drive the process from initial signals all the way to signed contracts. Sometimes hands-on, sometimes strategic, always in control. You set the structure, ask the right questions, and ensure we win the right business.
 



  





**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU? 💡** 



* Take ownership of a critical function that directly impacts company growth and success – your work will shape how we win new business
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Check out our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and central office in A House the Ark in Stockholm or at Kungsportplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Join a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!



  





**About The Role 📌** 




 As Bid Manager, you lead our full bid process from go/no-go decision to final submission. You’ll work on a broad range of bids – from public sector procurement under LOU to complex RFPs from enterprise customers in the private sector. You create structure, drive momentum and make sure every bid reflects high quality. You work closely with the sales team. They drive the commercial side, you own the process. You set timelines, raise the right questions and keep everything on track.
 



  





 This role is all about collaboration. You collect input from key stakeholders and collaborate across teams, partners, and framework suppliers to ensure smooth delivery. You manage complexity, bring clarity and keep things moving. Once we commit to a bid, you run the project in Loopio, align everyone involved and ensure the final result is complete, compliant and compelling. You follow up on outcomes and feed insights back into the business. You play a key role in helping us win the right deals, and you’re motivated by seeing your work lead to real results.
 



  





 You lead and coordinate all parts of the bid process from decision to submission, including:
 


* Developing and driving our overall bid and procurement strategy – ensuring alignment with our offering, target customers, and commercial goals
* Driving structure, clarity, and follow-up across teams
* Monitoring market and procurement trends, as well as public and private sector regulations, to optimize our bids
* Gathering input from key stakeholders and collaborating across teams, partners, and framework suppliers to ensure smooth delivery
* Taking ownership of Loopio – managing and reusing content, and continuously improving how we use the tool to make our bid process smarter and more efficient
* Identifying and flagging risks in the bid process, and proposing strategies to improve bid design. Taking responsibility for detecting deviations from the product offering, commercial terms, delivery, and Ideal Customer Profile (ICP)
* Tracking and evaluating the outcomes of procurement processes to ensure continuous learning and ongoing improvement of our bidding strategy and execution
* Contributing to winning more of the right business
* Continuously improving our bid process – identifying bottlenecks, streamlining workflows, and implementing best practices to ensure smarter, faster, and higher quality bids over time



  





**YOUR BACKGROUND ✔️** 



* Educational background from either a university or a vocational (YH) program in a relevant field
* 4+ years of experience working with bids and complex procurement processes
* Strong understanding of structured bidding, decision points, and stakeholder management
* Practical knowledge of public procurement regulations including LOU
* Proven ability to lead projects and coordinate cross-functional collaboration
* Comfortable using tools to support your work – ideally Loopio or similar
* Fluent in Swedish and English



  





**It is not a requirement but a bonus if you have:** 



* Experience from a sales role or leadership position within sales – beneficial, especially within SaaS
* Experience working closely with legal teams
* Familiarity with regulations such as CSDDD, NIS2, Åpenhetsloven, etc.



  





**About You 👀** 




 You are highly organized and business-minded with a strong drive to get things done. You enjoy balancing strategic, long-term thinking with close attention to detail, and you thrive in working hands-on to move projects forward and make things happen. You are not afraid to ask important and sometimes difficult questions, and you challenge assumptions when needed. Your clear communication and collaborative approach help bring people together and keep projects on track.
 



 You’re not here to drown in admin – you value structure and quality but also speed and simplicity. You’re comfortable working with smart tools and automations to eliminate manual work where possible, and you constantly look for ways to improve how we do things. You are humble and approachable, valuing teamwork and open dialogue. You focus on the opportunities that matter most and avoid chasing every lead. You take pride in your work and are motivated by winning business and making a real impact.
 



  





**About Us 🚀** 




 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
 



 Is this particular role not quite right for you - Show your interest by connecting with us, we are constantly looking for new talent for our growing business in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Oslo. We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Strategisk samordnare, Teknikförvaltningen, Fastighetskontoret, Stockholms stad
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Fastighetskontoret förvaltar och utvecklar ett unikt fastighetsbestånd viktigt för Stockholms invånare, företagare och besökare. Fastighetsbeståndet består av allt från välkända Stockholmsbyggnader till offentliga lokaler för kultur och idrott, kontorsbyggnader, brandstationer, saluhallar, slott, gårdar och torp. Vi förvaltar även natur- och friluftsområden utanför stadsgränsen. Vi sitter i Tekniska Nämndhuset på Fleminggatan 4, cirka 5 minuters promenad från Centralstationen.
   

  

**Välkommen till oss**
 Har du ett skarpt öga för analys och ett intresse för fastigheter och uppföljning?
   

  

 Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och utveckla vår tekniska förvaltning genom att bidra med din erfarenhet av analytisk samordning och god systemförståelse. Hos oss får du en varierad roll i en dynamisk organisation i ständig förändring. Det här är tjänsten för dig som trivs i ett högt tempo, gillar många kontaktytor och vill vara med och stärka Stockholms stads fastighetsbestånd – för alla som bor och verkar i vår stad.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig ett utvecklande arbete på en dynamisk arbetsplats, med chans att växa och utmanas inom ditt uppdrag och inom Stockholms stad.
   

  

 Till ditt stöd har du enhetschef, IT, ekonomi, samordnare och andra stödfunktioner. Vi är ett prestigelöst och engagerat gäng som delar med oss av kunskap och stöttar varandra. Vi värdesätter god stämning och har kul på jobbet.
   

  

 På Fastighetskontoret värnar vi om våra medarbetares välmående och erbjuder friskvårdsförmåner, flextid, lunchförmån och möjlighet att växla semesterdagstillägg mot extra ledighet. Om du delar våra värderingar och känner dig hemma i en miljö där ansvarstagande, nytänkande, professionalism och helhetsperspektiv präglar kulturen kommer du att trivas här.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I rollen som strategisk samordnare arbetar du planerande och genomförande utifrån ett helhetsperspektiv med inriktning på utveckling av system, bevakning och ekonomi. Du kommer agera enhetschefens högra hand och vara en stöttande del i det dagliga arbetet. Du kan också komma att arbeta med andra delar inom rollen. Jobbet är mångfasetterat och innebär att man behöver ha ett eget driv och vara lösningsorienterad.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter är breda och innefattar i huvudsak
   

  

* analys av enhetens arbetssätt och system
* samordna och följa upp den långsiktiga underhålls- och investeringsplanen
* bevaka utveckling av process, system och verktyg
* uppföljning av system
* samordning av bevakningsbehov
* registervård
* mötesledande ihop med enhetschef


**Din kompetens och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* relevant eftergymnasial utbildning från högskola, universitet eller yrkeshögskola, alternativt flerårig erfarenhet från branschen som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig
* aktuell och flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet från en liknande roll där du arbetat med uppföljning och samordning gärna inom fastighetsbranschen
* erfarenhet av utveckling av process, system och verktyg
* grundläggande kompetens av ekonomisk uppföljning
* erfarenhet av administrativa arbetsuppgifter och van användare av Officepaketets olika program
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska i både tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du har
   

  

* erfarenhet av att samordna och bevaka fastighetssystem
* kunskap om LOU och aktuella myndighetskrav
* kännedom om och förståelse för ABT och de olika entreprenadformerna
* grundläggande kunskap om fastigheter.


**Personliga förmågor och färdigheter**
 Denna tjänst passar dig som är lösningsorienterad, driven och målinriktad med stark analytisk förmåga. Du hanterar många olika delar parallellt och behöver därför trivas med att ha mycket på gång samtidigt. Då du ansvarar för ett stort antal bevakningar och processer är det också avgörande att du är strukturerad med god förmåga att planera och prioritera. Du har lätt för att kommunicera och samarbeta och är serviceinriktad i ditt bemötande. För att lyckas väl i rollen krävs också en hög grad av flexibilitet och förmåga att ställa om sitt förhållningssätt och arbetsuppgifter utifrån ändrade omständigheter och prioriteringar. Vi tycker också att det är viktigt att du verkar för vår värdegrund - ansvarstagande, nytänkande, professionalism och helhetsperspektiv. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet, motivation och engagemang för tjänsten.
   

  

**Mer om Fastighetsavdelningen**
 Fastighetsavdelningen förvaltar fastighetsnämndens fastigheter och byggnader men har även förvaltningsuppdrag åt andra nämnder inom staden. Några exempel på fastigheter är Kulturhuset Stockholms stadsbibliotek, Liljevalchs och Östermalmshallen samt idrottsanläggningar som exempelvis Eriksdalsbadet. Avdelningen består av fem enheter och innefattar förutom teknikförvaltning, två kundförvaltarenheter, driftenheten, samt enheten teknikspecialister.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Känner du igen dig i ovanstående beskrivning och är intresserad av en ny utmaning? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! För att stärka fokus på de kompetenser och erfarenheter som efterfrågas för denna roll behöver du inte bifoga ett personligt brev. Vid bedömningen av din ansökan kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och ett antal urvalsfrågor du får besvara i samband med att du söker tjänsten. Vi vill att du svarar konkret och kortfattat på frågorna, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.
   

  

 Tester kan komma att bli aktuellt i den senare delen av rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde snarast efter överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi ser mångfald som berikande och välkomnar alla sökande.
   

  

 Under del av ansökningsperioden är rekryterande chef på semester. Om du har några frågor går det bra att maila så återkommer vi när vi är tillbaka i arbete.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/4123 | Kontakt: Jonas Kroglund , Enhetschef , | Facklig företrädare: Reza Etemad, Vision 08-50826983, | Publicerat: 2025-07-07 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-10

title: Pricing Capabilities Development Analyst (SPO)
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com
   

  

****Job Function:****
 Market Access
   

  

****Job Sub Function:****
 Pricing
   

  

****Job Category:****
 Professional
   

  

**All Job Posting Locations:**
 Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands, Berlin, Germany, Brussels, Brussels-Capital Region, Belgium, Dublin, Ireland, Hamburg, Germany, Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland, London, United Kingdom, Madrid, Spain, Oslo, Norway, Paris, Île-de-France, France, Pomezia, Roma, Italy, Prague, Czechia, Stockholm, Stockholm, Sweden, Vienna, Austria, Zug, Switzerland
   

  

****Job Description:****
 At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.
   

  

**Pricing Capabilities Development Analyst (SPO) - Johnson & Johnson MedTech EMEA**
 Are you ready to elevate your career in the dynamic world of MedTech? We are seeking an analytical, data-driven
 **Pricing capabilities development Analyst (** 
**SPO** 
**)** 
 to lead efforts in refining our digital pricing strategies across the region. This role is pivotal in advancing our Smart CPQ (configure, price, quote) capabilities, focusing on data-driven insights, model enhancements, and optimization of our pricing solutions. You'll be at the forefront of implementing cutting-edge Smart CPQ (configure, price, quote) and price optimisation capabilities across the EMEA region.
   

  

 In this exciting role, you will collaborate with the EMEA Operational Pricing Lead, local pricing subject matter experts (SMEs), global pricing, finance as well as the wider project team to enhance and deliver across the region our digital pricing capability, Smart Price Optimisation (SPO), the engine which drives pricing recommendations within our Smart CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) capability. As an integral part of the EMEA Pricing & Tender Centre of Excellence in MedTech, your expertise will be crucial for ensuring the enhancement of the pricing optimisation model and deal scoring capabilities of CPQ, within a consistent regional template.
   

  

 In this strategic position, you will work alongside the EMEA Operational Pricing Lead, local pricing SMEs, and cross-functional teams to continually enhance our CPQ platform. Your contributions will directly influence how we deliver pricing recommendations, measure deal health, and embed analytical insights into our pricing practices to unlock new business opportunities.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
* Refine & Optimize the SPO Model: Collaborate with stakeholders to improve the smart price optimisation (SPO) model, ensuring accurate and impactful pricing recommendations calculated in SPO and available within CPQ.
* Enhance & Align Deal Scoring Logic: Drive the development, refinement, and alignment of scoring parameters used in CPQ to better assess deal health. Leverage your analytical competencies to introduce new scoring attributes and improve the overall accuracy and consistency across deal evaluations.
* Measure & Improve Pricing Performance: Track the effectiveness of pricing strategies by analysing the recommendations made by SPO and the deal scores generated. Use these insights to further optimize the recommendation engine and quantify business impact and opportunities.
* Deliver Insights & Analytics: Drive actionable analytics based on CPQ pricing data, identifying trends, opportunities, and risks. Work to embed these insights within the pricing scorecard and broader business strategies to support decision-making.
* Deployment & Adoption Support: Lead local market deployments of SPO and pricing model updates, ensuring data quality, user acceptance, and effective training. Work with local teams and data teams and other stakeholders to enrich data quality inputs to maximise the quality of the model recommendations.
* System Feature Development: Collaborate with SMEs to shape future enhancements to CPQ and SPO, driven by analytics and model performance insights. Partner with local teams, data and tech teams to deliver against local requirements in line with the regional template.
* Continuous Improvement & Alignment: Take ownership of refining deal scoring models, ensuring alignment across regions and consistency in deal assessment. Use analytical techniques to recommend improvements and monitor the effectiveness of scoring enhancements.
* Post-Implementation Support: Provide ongoing support during and after rollouts, focusing on data quality, model refinement, and increasing adoption based on insights.


****Qualifications****
* Bachelor's degree in business, finance, data science, or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in pricing, analytics, or related commercial roles, with strong analytical competencies and experience applying data-driven decision-making.
* Proven expertise in developing, refining, and aligning deal scoring models and parameters in complex sales environments.
* Deep understanding of pricing models, scoring logic, and tools for measuring deal health and pricing effectiveness.
* Experience with CPQ, price optimisation solutions and the modelling of pricing deals is a plus.
* Knowledge of ERP systems such as SAP S/4HANA and JDE is advantageous.
* Ability to translate complex data into clear insights, recommendations, and strategic actions.
* Project experience: the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and manage concurring tasks efficiently.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams and stakeholders.
* Growth mindset, curiosity, and an innovative approach to problem-solving.


****Disclaimer:****
 The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job
   

  

 At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/
   

  

****Job Description****
 The
 **Revenue & Margin Assurance Pricing Manager** 
 , will be responsible for driving execution of regional pricing & commercial strategies focused on profitable growth to meet financial commitments for MedTech in Europe, Middle East & Affrica (EMEA). The incumbent will be responsible in liaising with key cross-functional partners on a global, regional, and local level to ensure alignment on business planning, commercial readiness, tactical execution and will oversee critical strategic projects that fuel profitable growth.
   

  

 Following the Johnson & Johnson Credo, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their sexual orientation, gender, age, religion, culture, origin, family status or disability.
 **https://www.jnj.com/credo/**
****Key Responsibilities****
* Pricing & Commercial Execution: Oversee the profit acceleration initiative, focusing on pricing, product mix, service programs, and addressing revenue leakage. Monitor adherence to profit strategies, providing structured analyses and action plans to resolve issues as they arise.
* Pricing Business Planning: Lead pricing and profit planning and revisions for all business units, establishing processes for insight collection and providing guidance on account segmentation and planning. Identify upside and risk opportunities to inform business planning.
* Price Optimization & Process Management: Drive the end-to-end price optimization process, including monitoring market dynamics, competitor pricing, and customer insights to identify opportunities for maximizing revenue and margins. Manage and oversee the entire pricing lifecycle, ensuring alignment with strategic goals, operational excellence, and compliance standards at each stage.
* Price Compliance & Governance: Ensure strict adherence to internal policies, external regulations, and company standards related to pricing. Implement governance frameworks to oversee pricing activities, review price changes for compliance, and mitigate risks associated with pricing practices.
* Stakeholder Coordination: Coordinate quarterly country reviews and commercial councils, ensuring timely resolution of action items. Act as the primary liaison for profit initiatives across various stakeholders, including regional and local Finance, Strat Caps Leaders, and Business leaders.
* Pricing Analytics & Insights: Develop and leverage advanced analytic tools to analyze pricing, revenue, and margin data. Provide insights and actionable recommendations based on comprehensive analysis to support strategic decision-making and improve profitability.
* Project Management: Manage critical strategic projects linked to the overall MedTech strategy, leading complex initiatives with significant business impact. Create communication materials and stakeholder engagement plans to align with senior leadership.
* Training & Development: Elevate business acumen within the organization by collaborating with Education Solutions to provide training on pricing, business, and selling capabilities.


****Qualifications****
**Education and Experience**
* Strong analytical and financial modeling skills (5-8 years’ experience) with proficiency in advanced analytics tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau, Power BI)
* Solid experience in marketing, sales and pricing (2-4 years’ experience) ideally in Medical Devices, with proven track record in change management.
* Experience in driving profit initiatives such as pricing optimization, customer segmentation, portfolio & customer mix and revenue assurance
* Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Economics, Data science or related field; master’s degree or MBA preferred
* Understanding of healthcare market dynamics and hospital landscape
* Proven ability to understand business strategy; translating strategy into operational activities and drive execution.
* Proven project management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives. Ability to navigate complex matrix organizations.


****Skills And Abilities****
* Creative, practical problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and ideally also in other languages
* Proactive, enthusiastic, curious, flexible
* High work ethics and confidentiality
* Effective interpersonal and teamwork skills
* Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage different priorities
* Ability to work with high level of autonomy in a challenging environment
* Willingness to travel locally, globally as required (20% of time)
* Knowledge and Understanding of Legal and Health Care Compliance policies


****Disclaimer:****
 The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job
   

  

**Please note that this position can be located at any EMEA J&J office.**

title: Head of Business Development
description:
Vill du vara med och forma DHL Freights framtida affärer? Är du driven, affärsmässig och vill tillhöra ett professionellt och engagerat team där man drivs av att hjälpa sina kunder med de bästa transport- och logistiklösningarna i Sverige. Då är kanske detta din nästa utmaning! DHL Freight söker nu Head of Business Development DHL arbetar med att få kunders vardag att fungera. Som ett av de ledande företagen i världen inom logistik, ser de till att deras kunder får leverans av varor och material. Utan transporter stannar samhället, de har ett viktigt uppdrag – Förena människor och förbättra liv. Som medarbetare hos DHL är du en viktig nyckelspelare.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som Head of Business Development har du ett övergripande ansvar för att säkerställa lönsamheten på kort- och långsikt inom produkten Parti Domestic för DHL Freight i Sverige. Rollen innebär ansvar för löpande underhåll av DHL Freight´s partiprodukt, samt att på en strategisk nivå också planera, initiera och genomföra långsiktig utveckling och därigenom stärka DHL Freights marknadserbjudande över tid genom aktivt arbete med deras kunder. Rollen är direkt operativ i form av att stödja säljorganisationen i komplexa kundcase och utbildningar samt att ställa krav mot Operations gällande kvalitétsnivåer och processefterlevnad. I rollen som Head Of Business Development förväntas du driva affärsutvecklingen för NTBO (Non terminal based operations) framåt i enlighet med verksamhetens mål. Du leder och coachar ett drivet och engagerat team bestående av erfarna specialister inom området. Då teamet är spritt på flera orter behöver du ha god erfarenhet av att leda team framgångsrikt på distans. Resor förekommer regelbundet med flexibelt upplägg. Lämplig bostadsort för tjänsten är främst Örebro men även Stockholm är tänkbart. Du ingår i ledningsgrupp och rapporterar till Director NTBO Domestic and Specialities.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak**
* Ansvarar för att leda, coacha och utveckla Business Development teamet enligt uppsatta planer och mål
* Bidra med prisexpertis till organisationen och utveckla och underhålla prisverktyg inom NTBO (Non terminal based operations)
* Säkerställa att kapacitet och balanskartor finns som underlag för försäljning
* På uppdrag och tillsammans med Local Production Manager, gå igenom behov och tillgänglig kapacitet
* Ansvarar för att ta fram utvecklingsplan för parti inrikes nätverk i samråd med funktionen Network.
* Kravställa kontinuerlig produktutveckling på kort- och lång sikt för att möta marknadens krav
* Stödja säljorganisationen i komplexa kundcase för att säkerställa lönsam tillväxt


**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du en gedigen transport- och logistikkunskap och tidigare erfarenhet inom vägtransporter, transportplanering och försäljning. Du har erfarenhet av liknande roll inom affärsutveckling där du arbetat operativt mot kunder och du har förmåga att bygga och bibehålla långsiktiga relationer både internt och externt. Då du förväntas skapa förutsättningar för framtida utveckling av nya och befintliga affärer inom NTBO tror vi att du motiveras av utmaningar och har höga ambitioner. Du har god social kompetens, ett affärsmässigt bemötande och dokumenterade goda ledaregenskaper. Vi ser gärna att du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område, universitetsbakgrund är meriterande. Du har god IT- och systemkunskap, kunskap i Officepaketet med Excel är ett krav, och du kommunicerar väl på både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Som ledare är du trygg och handlingskraftig med god kommunikationsförmåga och du har förmågan att entusiasmera dina medarbetare. För att vara framgångsrik i rollen krävs ett genuint engagemang och en stark initiativförmåga. Det är inte ovanligt med snabba förändringar så det gäller att du trivs att vara där det händer och att du tar ansvar, strukturerar och fullföljer dina och verksamhetens uppdrag med stor noggrannhet och flexibilitet.
   

  

**Om verksamheten**
 På DHL trivs man och många har jobbat där länge. DHL är ett företag som ser sina medarbetares utveckling och potential – som vågar satsa på sina medarbetare! I det stora globala, och internationella bolaget som de är, har de en härlig teamkänsla med familjär stämning där man respekterar varandra. Här finns mycket medarbetarengagemang samt humor och man tycker om att fira framgångar. DHL är certifierade i Top Employer vilket innebär att de är en arbetsgivare som erbjuder den bästa arbetsmiljön för medarbetare att utvecklas både professionellt och personligt. Miljö och hållbarhet är viktigt, man arbetar ständigt med att utvecklas för att ligga i framkant, vilket uppmärksammas och ger resultat. DHL tar ansvar och blev bland annat utsedda till branschvinnare av Sustainable Brand Index B2B för tredje året i rad. DHL är marknadsledande inom logistikbranschen och är ”logistikbolaget för hela världen”. DHL erbjuder expertis inom internationell express-, flyg- och sjöfrakt, väg- och tågtransport, kontraktslogistik samt internationella brevtjänster. DHL ingår i koncernen Deutsche Post DHL som finns i 220 länder och har 570 000 anställda. Läs gärna mer på www.dhl.com Har du ytterligare frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Pernilla Dawidson Göranzon, Poolia på 070-090 62 49, pernilla.dawidson-goranzon@poolia.se. DHL tillämpar provanställning vid nyanställningar. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Enligt EU-direktiv (2009/52/EG) måste DHL som arbetsgivare kunna påvisa sina medarbetares rättighet att arbeta inom EU. Vid en anställning på DHL måste du därför kunna uppvisa din rätt att arbeta inom EU genom medborgarskap (exempelvis pass) eller i annat fall uppvisa ditt arbetstillstånd. DHL genomför bakgrundskontroller på alla slutkandidater.

title: Account Manager, CT&I Sverige
description:
I rollen som Account Manager kommer du att vara ansvarig för att driva tillväxt inom segmenten entreprenad, transport och industri (Construction, Transportation & Industry förkortat CT&I). Du kommer att initiera, utveckla och upprätthålla relationer med nya partners, samt maximera försäljningsvolymerna från vår befintliga portfölj av leverantör- och återförsäljarpartners. Du kommer att ha ett kontinuerligt fokus på att uppnå höga nivåer av partnernöjdhet. Med hänsyn till ditt verksamhetsområde så är resor i tjänsten vanligt.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i, och arbete tätt tillsammans med ett säljteam som kommer att guida dig i vårt arbetssätt och våra värdegrunder, men din framgång kommer vara beroende av ditt driv och din strävan efter att lyckas växa vår affär. Utöver ditt närmsta säljteam kommer du även att arbeta tätt tillsammans med medlemmar från ett flertal avdelningar internt såsom Kreditanalytiker, Sales Support, Legal och Marknad.
   

  

 Läs mer här om hur du kan förverkliga din fulla potential på DLL
   

  

**Dagligt Arbete**
* Affärsutveckling & nätverkande – Initiera och utvecklar nya affärsrelationer genom befintligt nätverk, kundstock och rekommendationer.
* Nykundsbearbetning – Aktiv prospektering via databaser, egen analys, telefonkontakt, sociala medier och andra nätverk.
* Förståelse för säljcykler & affärsrelationer – Har djup insikt i komplexa säljprocesser och vikten av långsiktiga samarbeten, samt förståelse för samspelet mellan tillverkare, återförsäljare och slutanvändare.
* Kundhantering & analys – Erfarenhet av att hantera konton i olika storlekar, underhålla pipeline och portfölj, analysera data och kommunicera på flera nivåer inom organisationer.
* Operativt säljansvar – Ansvarar för hela säljprocessen inklusive kreditförfrågningar, dokumentation och avtal – med målet att skapa affärer.
* Utbildning & kunskapsdelning – Utvecklar och genomför utbildningar inom finansiering, både på plats hos kund och digitalt.
* Relationsbyggande & uppföljning – Genomför regelbundna uppföljningsmöten med partners för analys och relationsfördjupning.


**Medlemmarnas förmåner**
* Ägna två dagar per år åt volontärarbete.
* Flexibla arbetstider med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån
* Möjligheter till karriärutveckling: onlineutbildning, utvecklingsprogram för medlemmar.
* Klicka på den här länken för en översikt på förmånerna i din region.


*”Våra lösningar uppfyller de förväntningar våra kunder har idag, men vi förutser även framtidens marknadsbehov.”*
**Nödvändigheter**
 Vi söker en självgående och affärsdriven person med passion för finansiering som gör skillnad. Du har erfarenhet av att bygga och förvalta affärsrelationer med både uthållighet och precision, och du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativt ansvar. Med din kunskap inom objektsfinansiering – gärna från leasing eller återförsäljarledet – är du van vid att förhandla komplexa avtal och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som möter kundens behov.
   

  

 Du är en skicklig kommunikatör som rör dig obehindrat på alla nivåer i en organisation, och du använder sociala medier och egna analyser som verktyg för att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter. Du har ett analytiskt sinne, är lösningsorienterad och van vid att arbeta mot tydliga mål i ett högt tempo. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en reglerad miljö och i nära samarbete med partners är meriterande, liksom vana att ta fram marknadsanalyser och säljstrategier i team. Framför allt är du en lagspelare som drivs av att skapa värde – för kunder, kollegor och affären.
   

  

 Välj välbefinnande
   

  

 DLL:s ambition är att utbilda, utrusta och ge medlemmarna möjlighet att skapa ett nätverk, hantera sitt mentala, känslomässiga, fysiska och ekonomiska välbefinnande och upprätthålla balansen mellan arbete och andra prioriteringar som utgör deras liv.
   

  

**Våra Fyra Friskvårdskategorier Är Följande**
* Kontakter – Skapa meningsfulla relationer med andra DLL-medlemmar
* Hälsa – hantera mental, känslomässig och fysisk hälsa
* Ekonomi – Vi tillhandahåller utbildningsmöjligheter för att hjälpa medlemmar att uppnå ekonomisk stabilitet
* Livsstil – Upprätthålla balans mellan arbete och privatliv


 Det är dessa saker som är viktiga för våra medlemmar och våra medlemmars välbefinnande är viktigt för DLL
   

  

 Komma till rätta
   

  

 Vi är många saker på DLL. Vi är teammedlemmar, familjemedlemmar, medborgare. Vi är medborgare med olika kulturer och nationaliteter. Vi är en del av förändringen. Vi har alla olika övertygelser, olika passioner, olika synsätt, talanger och intressen. Vi kommer från olika bakgrunder, kulturer, nationaliteter och bakgrunder.
   

  

 Men trots alla våra olikheter har vi en sak gemensamt: vi är alla medlemmar i DLL.
   

  

 Vårt företag grundades i Nederländerna. Men idag är vi verkligen ett multinationellt företag. Vår unika kultur bygger på ökat samarbete, mindre hierarki och ärlighet som gör det möjligt för oss att integrera, skapa idéer och förnya oss över landsgränserna.
   

  

 Många företag säger att de är europeiska, amerikanska, asiatiska eller australiensiska, men på DLL är vi alla dessa platser och mer därtill.
   

  

 Vi är ett tvärkulturellt kooperativ – ett sammanlänkat nätverk – som träffas varje dag med ett mål i sikte:
 **Samarbete för en bättre värld!**
**Bra Att Veta**
* Sista ansökningsdag: 17.08.2025 (På grund av den stora mängden ansökningar kan denna annons stängas före det angivna slutdatumet)
* Urvalsprocessen kan omfatta en bedömning.
* Ansökningar via e-post kommer inte att behandlas. Ansök online via vår karriärwebbplats.
* DLL:s referensprogram gäller
* För mer information kan du kontakta Joep Staps, rekryterare via joep.staps@dllgroup.com
* #IND123


 DLL uppskattar den tid du lägger på att ansöka till våra lediga tjänster. Observera att vi kontaktar endast de som är kvalificerade. En bakgrundskontroll måste genomföras med godkänt resultat för att få en anställning.
   

  

 DLL är en arbetsgivare som erbjuder lika möjligheter. Vi strävar efter inkluderande och tillgängliga rekryterings- och urvalsprocesser och arbetsmiljöer. Om du kontaktas för en anställning ska du meddela HR om du behöver boende i enlighet med våra värderingar och all tillämplig lagstiftning.
   

  

**Om DLL**
*DLL är ett globalt finansbolag för utrustning och teknik med tillgångar på över 40 miljarder euro. Företaget grundades 1969 och har huvudkontor i Eindhoven i Nederländerna. DLL erbjuder finansiella lösningar inom lantbruk, livsmedel, hälso- och sjukvård, miljövänlig teknik, entreprenad, transport, industri, kontorsutrustning samt IT i över 25 länder. DLL samarbetar med tillverkare, återförsäljare och distributörer samt direkt med slutkunder för att göra det lättare för företag att få tillgång till utrustning, teknik och programvara. Företaget tillhandahåller även kunskap och råd till partners och kunder som ger smartare och mer ekonomiska användningsmetoder. Genom att kombinera kundfokus med djupgående branschkunskap levererar DLL hållbara finansiella lösningar för produkternas livscykler, som till exempel lagerfinansiering, detaljhandelsfinansiering och finansiering av begagnad utrustning. DLL är ett helägt dotterbolag inom Rabobank-koncernen.*
*Du kan läsa mer om DLL på* 
*www.dllgroup.com*

title: Group Safety and Health Manager
description:
Global Safety and Health Manager Position
   

  

 Do you want to help us accelerate the transformation in the mining and construction industry? Demand for critical metals and minerals will sharply increase as we transition to a climate-neutral society. Our role is to help extract these minerals and metals in the most sustainable way possible. Now, we're seeking a highly motivated Global Safety and Health Manager
   

  

 Are you someone who is analytic, has strong project management skills and thinks safety and health is key? It all starts with people like you.
   

  

**Your mission**
 As a key member of our Sustainability and SHEQ team, you'll play a vital role as we strive to eliminate work-related injuries and reach our 2030 goal of no work-related injuries. As a Safety and Health Manager, you will further develop and improve the safety culture in Epiroc, drive meaningful changes, support and guide the organization and strengthen our competitive position and meet customer demands.
   

  

 You will lead collaboration activities with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders and provide support to various groups.
   

  

 You will work closely with colleagues both at Group level but also with divisions and local level. You will report to VP Sustainability.
   

  

 Your responsibilities and tasks will include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Drive and implement global strategic and operational safety and health improvements in collaboration with divisions and local level.
* Promote, support and guide the organization on safety and health issues.
* Share best practices and deploy prevention tools.
* Develop and communicate Group guidelines and requirements.
* Lead internal safety projects.
* Follow up health and safety performance as well as highlight areas where we need to improve.
* Application owner of common OHS applications and processes.
* Develop internal training.
* Collection, consolidation, and analysis of ESG data for reporting and internal decision-making.
* Drive continuous improvement.
* Monitor new reporting requirements and develop processes to utilize sustainability data to advance our agenda.
* Perform internal audits on entities and on divisions.
* Work with other sustainability topics.


 In this role you will not have any direct reporting staff, but you will ensure success through collaboration with the divisions and the entities in the Group.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To succeed as our Global Safety and Health Manager, you should have:
   

  

* A Bachelor or a Master Degree of science, sustainability, industrial engineering, behavioral science or similar.
* Several years of relevant work experience, preferably from an operational environment, from multinational companies or similar.
* Familiarity with laws, regulations and standards in the OHS area.
* Strong analytical skills to gather, analyze and make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent project management skills.
* Great skills in MS Office (especially in Excel) and Power BI.
* Bilingual in Swedish & English with strong verbal & written communication skills in both languages.
* A keen interest in health and safety and an understanding of the complexity in a decentralized multi-national organization under various legislations and regulations.


 If you're a curious, enthusiastic, and pragmatic individual with a results-oriented mindset, along with a passion for health and safety and sustainability, combined with the determination to drive change, we extend a warm invitation for you to join our team.
   

  

 We believe you are a true networker that can naturally build relationships and influence across functions and divisions to adopt best practices and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Together, let's embark on a journey to create excellence and shape the future of the mining and construction industry.
   

  

**Location and travel**
 This position is preferably in Stockholm or Örebro, Sweden. Occasional travel is required. Both domestic and international, mainly to our entities, but also to customers and to other relevant events.
   

  

**Life at Epiroc**
 By joining our team, you can expect an atmosphere of creativity, innovation, and workplace diversity. You will be a part of a group of skilled and helpful colleagues who live by our core values: Collaboration, Commitment, and Innovation. We work in a global environment with over 113 different nationalities!
   

  

 In addition to the fact that we have a culture that is characterized by development combined with having a good balance between work and leisure, there are some things that make us a little extra proud to work at Epiroc:
   

  

* Global career opportunities
* Epiroc University, for your own competence development
* Community involvement
* Benefits package, which amongst other things include flexible working hours and a bonus.


**A hybrid workplace**
 Life in Epiroc can include the possibility of a hybrid workplace. It is a way of working that offers flexibility and participation, allowing for a better balance between work and private life, which also promotes well-being. The hybrid workplace is an opportunity if work allows, based on your role, responsibilities, and individual conditions.
   

  

**Application and contact information**
 You are welcome to submit your application as soon as possible by creating an account in our recruitment system. In this recruitment process, we review applications continuously. The last day to apply for this position is
 **August 21st, 2025.**
 For questions about the position please contact Nina Fazeli, Recruitment Specialist, at nina.fazeli@external.epiroc.com
   

  

*Please note that due to regulations, we cannot handle applications received through email.*
*We have already made our choices regarding advertising channels and consulting providers, and kindly request not to be contacted regarding such inquiries.*
**Epiroc** 
 is a global productivity partner for mining and construction customers, and accelerates the transformation toward a sustainable society. With ground-breaking technology, Epiroc develops and provides innovative and safe equipment, such as drill rigs, rock excavation and construction equipment and tools for surface and underground applications. The company also offers world-class service and other aftermarket support as well as solutions for automation, digitalization and electrification. Epiroc is based in Stockholm, Sweden, had revenues of more than SEK 60 billion in 2023, and has around 18 200 passionate employees supporting and collaborating with customers in around 150 countries. Learn more at www.epiroc.com.

title: SAP Solution Architect (Nuclear Business)
description:
Vattenfall is recognized as one of the first movers in the energy transition – and by that power climate smarter living for all our customers.
   

  

 Yet, our investment power, innovation, and ambitious change agenda to become fossil free in one generation, can only be met if we can rely on the reliable and competivive generation of our Nuclear plants. To face this challenge we invest in our people and we continue to employ exceptional IT talent. With our team, we are advancing Vattenfall Nuclear to become a data driven company, allowing them to optimize decision making and investment planning.
   

  

**This Means We Are Architecting**
* Our enterprise asset management and logistics on SAP S/4HANA
* An integrated and hybrid SAP and surrounding systems landscape consisting of multiple instances (cloud and onpremise)
* Solutions that are critical to Swedish infrastructure and its society and thus regulated under Säkerhetsskyddslag (2018:585)
* Full IT/OT convergence to ensure frictionless transfer of data (near) real time to advance predictive maintenance use cases
* IT infrastructure and solutions that are hyper-scalable and reliable
* Strategic solutions/landscapes to optimize Nuclear maintenance strategies


 Our team requires true Business facing Solution architects; You know how to use technology to make Nuclear run as
 *clockwork* 
 , you act as
 *timer* 
 to ensure we meet our ambitious goals and be an
 *alarm* 
 if we can do better! We have a large SAP and Microsoft footprint, with more than 20.000 users in six countries
   

  

 Our Group IT Architecture team of 30 enterprise / solution architects is involved in around 100+ key projects at any time, focusing on enterprise architecture and solution architecture for all Vattenfall business units. We act as the hub to understand business needs and to see the bigger Vattenfall picture to help our teams securely adopt the technologies of tomorrow.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* You will join the larger strategic projects, to guide them into successful execution based on fit-for-purpose architecture
* You will consult and educate the Nuclear business on SAP, IT strategy, integration strategy, data strategy and SAP strategy, etc
* You have a solid understanding of IT security and will support Nuclear in fit-for-purpose adoption.
* You will have (or build up) Nuclear and SAP domain knowledge to become the go-to point how advance its S/4 journey.
* You will help us grow our Enterprise thinking and establish standards and architecture principles. You will be our trusted advisor towards our Nuclear and other business area’s to enable their operating model by technology – also if that is that means radical change!


**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Our ideal candidate**
 We are looking for a seasoned Solution Architect, that has hands-on experience with SAP solution architecture, preferably (in prior assignments) as SAP Architect in water or energy utilities, manufacturing, or automotive.
   

  

 You Feel Comfortable Communicating With Both IT And Non-IT Colleagues On Different Levels In The Organization. You Enjoy Being In An Ever-changing Environment. Furthermore, You Bring
   

  

* An academic degree in IT or related study
* You speak Swedish and English
* Experience with Enterprise Architecture and Frameworks in an international environment
* You have deep SAP technical knowledge and general IT knowledge
* Ideally you have worked in an asset intensive industry – and understand security considerations, IEC 62443, ISO27001 etc.
* Experience with Microsoft Azure Well Architected Framework
* Skills to produce enterprise ready architecture documents and todirect complex problems into concise Management Board action
* And we love architects talk business and know TOGAF, rather than those that talk TOGAF and know business …


**Location** 
 : for this position you are expected to be already based in Sweden with willingness to travel regularly to the office (Stockholm, Solna). Occasionally also travel to key Nuclear locations, like Ringhals, Forsmark, Oskarshamm or team meetings in Amsterdam and Berlin; You will be expected to travel approximately a once month for two days to these locations.
   

  

**Our Offer**
* Become part of a massive transformative purpose – not on paper, but in real-life – whereby you can influence the outcome!
* We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field.
* You will work in an interdisciplinary team with other senior IT Architects – so we do this together!
* A professional environment where your experience, knowledge and attitude will bring us one step further and the opportunity for you to grow further.
* A central office location with easy access by public transport.
* Furthermore, a healthy work-life balance (smart working) and time to develop your profession
* At Vattenfall you get the opportunity to work for a clean energy company that aims for creating fossil free energy within one generation.
* And last but not least; International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic, motivated colleagues that like to have fun as well!


 Additional Information
   

  

**About Vattenfall**
 Energy is our contribution to quality of life – day after day. With around 20.000 colleagues Vattenfall provides comprehensive electricity and heating offerings to several million customers in northern Europe. For the work ahead we need people who are fully dedicated to our customers and to a sustainable society – people like you.
   

  

**More information**
 We welcome your application in English, including CV and cover letter via our website. For information about the position, please contact recruiting manager Emile Das, +31 6 5250 4359. For more information about the recruitment process, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Folmer Koper +31 6 38710915.
   

  

 At Vattenfall, we are convinced that striving for diversity helps building a more profitable, efficient and attractive company. We continue to seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of gender, age, ethnic and cultural backgrounds.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

title: Platform Engineer - Network
description:
* **Job ID:** R0012033-2
* **Date posted:** 31/07/2025
* We are on the journey to transform our digital capabilities, bringing core business processes, people, data & technology together - an enabler for IKEA to become an even better home furnishing retailer in the future. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things!
* **About the area**
* Inter IKEA Group is organised in three core businesses - Range, Supply and Retail Concept - and five enabling functions. Together we contribute to the success of IKEA and share responsibility for the franchise offer.
* The enabling functions lead key common activities in networks across Inter IKEA Group, as well as cover specific needs for the core businesses. The five Enabling functions are Operations Management, Business Performance & Support, Communication, Sustainability and People & Culture.
* **About the job**
* As a Platform engineer Network, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining the underlying systems that power large-scale infrastructure.
* This role requires deep understanding of infrastructure components, ensuring the reliability, scalability, and efficiency of critical connectivity and systems.
* **Responsibilities:**
* You will contribute to the creation and implementation of IT infrastructure architecture blueprints and high level design of IT services. You will support the implementation via the development of roadmaps, standards and guidelines. You will also support the digital innovation and transformation journey with new information technologies, expanding our capabilities with current but with focus on new technology platforms & foundations to enable us to meet the many people and explore new opportunities to develop a future-proof IKEA.
* **You will support IKEA by:**
* + Operating, developing, architecting and delivering IT Connectivity and services to agreed requirements without compromising the security.
	+ Developing and delivering to connectivity roadmaps as well as contribute to Digital and IT frameworks for network architecture and network security.
	+ Supporting multiple business projects and assignments with competence to deliver user-centric products and services based on HPE/Aruba network product stack.
	+ Leading and working cross functionally across IKEA to develop and deliver connectivity technology and services that enable the business to contribute to a strong and relevant IKEA franchise offer, always with the customer in focus.
	+ Orchestrating great connectivity using IKEA frameworks, new delivery models and multiple delivery partners.
* **About you**
* You are passionate and curious about the assignment of Inter IKEA and see how Digital and Information Technology can enable our way forward to create a unique and successful meeting with the customer. You are a down-to-earth team player who is eager to take initiatives and achieve results that deliver to a longer-term strategic agenda as well as to the operational and tactical implementation of available and supported IT platform infrastructure. You are appreciated for your way with people and ability to build trustful relationships through effective collaboration and delivery of results in agile ways of working. You strive for constant renewal of IT services and processes to move our business forward by providing platforms, services and solutions with a customer centric mind set.
* You would bring solid experience and knowledge (at least 3 years) in designing, managing and developing IT connectivity and a thorough understanding of different connectivity technologies such as Switching & Routing, (SD)WAN and DNS.
* **Preferred Qualifications**:
* + Certifications in relevant areas such as Aruba networking, SDWAN and (as bonus) cloud connectivity.
	+ Familiarity with DevOps principles and practices, including Agile methodologies.
  

**More Information*** This is a full-time role (40-hours per week) based in Malmö, Sweden or Delft, Netherlands reporting to the Platform Manager for Network & Connectivity.
* If you would like to know more about the role, please connect with Pär Hernflo (par.hernflo@inter.ikea.com ) or if you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with Wayne van Tonder (wayne.van.tonder@inter.ikea.com).
* Interested? Submit your CV and let us know why you would be a good fit for this role, in English, by the 17th of August 2025.
* At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.
* If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Senior AI Solutions Engineer
description:
About the Role
  
As a Senior AI Solutions Engineer, you will drive the end-to-end design, development, and deployment of cutting-edge AI solutions. You'll architect and build scalable microservices and APIs using Python and Java, while leveraging your expertise in large language models, vector databases and semantic similarity search.
  
In addition, you'll develop and maintain data pipelines with Airflow, ensure robust CI/CD and IaC practices (Terraform, CloudFormation), and containerise solutions using Docker and Kubernetes. Your work will span multiple cloud environments AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, CodePipeline, AWS Bedrock) and Azure (Azure AI Foundry) and integrate front-end customisations in JavaScript/TypeScript for chatbots and interactive interfaces. You'll also contribute to modular, scalable RAG platform development, integrating structured and unstructured data sources working closely with Lead AI Solutions engineer.
  
By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you'll transform raw data into actionable insights, delivering AI-driven innovations that power our analytics applications and shape the future of data-centric decision-making across the organisation.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
AI System Architecture & Development
  
Design, implement, and optimise AI-driven applications using Python (Hugging Face Transformers, Langchain) and Java.
  
Incorporate advanced NLP and LLM techniques (e.g., embeddings, semantic search) to enhance data insights and user experiences.
  
  

**AI & RAG System Development:**  

Design and build scalable RAG systems, including chatbots and AI assistants, leveraging cutting-edge ML/LLM techniques.
  
Develop backend APIs and microservices using Python frameworks and Java for seamless integration with our existing services.
  
  

**Data Engineering & Integration:**  

Design and maintain efficient data pipelines for real-time and batch processing, integrating structured data (SQL, data warehousing) and unstructured sources (documents, reports).
  
Utilise Airflow to orchestrate ETL workflows and ensure robust data processing.
  
Implement pipelines for LLM-based querying, embedding extraction, and metadata processing.
  
Ensure compliance with data governance, privacy, and security policies.
  
  

**Cloud & Infrastructure Management:**  

Deploy and manage applications on AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, CloudFormation, Terraform, CodePipeline, AWS Bedrock) and Azure (Azure AI Foundry including Functions and Agentic Workflows).
  
Collaborate with Platform Engineering to support Kubernetes deployments on FDJ's Cloud.
  
Ensure security integration with SSO platforms (e.g. Azure SSO, SailPoint).
  
Implement containerisation with Docker and Kubernetes while using CI/CD best practices and infrastructure as code (IaC) to ensure seamless deployments.
  
  

**Vector Databases & Semantic Search:**  

Manage and optimise vector databases (PGVector, ChromaDB) to support semantic similarity search using cosine similarity techniques.
  
Integrate embedding models (Sentence Transformers, OpenAI Embeddings) to enhance data retrieval quality.
  
Ensure indexing performance and accuracy in semantic search systems.
  
  

**Frontend & API Development:**  

Collaborate on developing interactive UI components (using JavaScript/TypeScript) for chatbot customisation and data visualisation.
  
Ensure that APIs are well-documented, secure, and scalable to support self-service analytics.
  
  

**Team Collaboration & Mentorship:**  

Work with data analysts, data engineers, and platform engineers to create a cohesive AI ecosystem.
  
Mentor junior team members and lead knowledge transfer sessions to promote best practices across the organisation.
  
  

Required Skills & Qualifications
  
5+ years of experience in data engineering, backend development, or AI/ML integration.
  
Strong proficiency in Python and Java.
  
Extensive hands-on experience with AWS services (EC2, S3, Lambda, CloudFormation, Terraform, CodePipeline, AWS Bedrock) and Azure AI Foundry.
  
  

**Data & AI Technologies:**  

Expertise in vector databases (PGVector/ChromaDB) and semantic similarity search (cosine similarity).
  
Proficient with embedding techniques using Sentence Transformers and OpenAI Embeddings.
  
**DevOps & CI/CD:** Demonstrated experience in containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes), CI/CD pipelines, and IaC practices.
  
**API & Data Integration:** Proven track record in API development and managing data pipelines & warehousing solutions.
  
**Frontend Exposure:** Experience with JavaScript/TypeScript for enhancing chatbot customisations and interactive data interfaces.
  
Strong problem-solving skills, excellent communication, and a collaborative, agile mindset.
  
  

Nice-to-Have Skills
  
Experience fine-tuning large LLMs for domain-specific applications.
  
Prior work in self-service analytics or AI-powered business intelligence solutions.
  
Additional experience with Airflow for advanced ETL orchestration.
  
  

What We Offer
  
A dynamic, innovative work environment where bold ideas are celebrated.
  
Opportunity to work with cross-functional experts in AI, data engineering, and cloud technologies.
  
Competitive salary and benefits, with opportunities for professional growth and continuous learning.

title: Group Project Manager
description:
1. Should have around minimum 20+ years of experience in Delivery
  
2. Solution / Technology mind set
  
a. Should have a good experience on backend, frontend, data, devops stack across any technology. Should be able to conceptualize the solution and should be able to drive customer conversation for a business problem, with a conceptual architecture, solution, delivery plan
  
b. Should be able to aware of the latest trends on what is happening in Digital space. Ex: knowledge on SRE, automation testing avenues, predictive analytics , AI, automation techniques
  
  

**3. Delivery readiness:**  

a. Should have hands on experience in terms of managing identification of talent, either individual or squad based construct along with coaching and mentoring of the squad before onboarding
  
  

**4. People management:**  

a. Should have good people management skills to ensure that each of the squad member is fully integrated to HCL and customer
  
b. Career path , mentoring along with running the team with Servant leadership model
  
c. Should have the experience of integration of people who is working in customer location to the parent organization – like every month townhall, every sprint meet n greet , proficiency upgrade, upskill/cross skill – act as a people leader to build the next Generation digital engineering talent
  
d. Integrate with local agencies for talent enablement and also with Universities to attract / onboard good engineering talent for future talent base
  
5. Should have good experience and hands on in terms of
  
a. Agile way of working and delivery – should have delivered transformation programs end to end in either in SCRUM / SPOTIFY using KANBAN OR STORY POINTS based techniques
  
b. Should have worked with the teams to help on estimation, agile ceremonies formulation along with creation of DOD and DOR for each squad
  
c. Experience in terms of identification of potential impediments and focus on resolutions and should have practical hands on experience on those
  
**6. DEX:** should have good experience on the following
  
a. Should be able to challenge the team and customer on either delivery execution, scope, timelines along with giving solutions that solve the problems. Should be thinking on feet kind of professional
  
7. Operational and finance management experience
  
a. Should be responsible for managing P&L for Sweden. Should be on top of revenue, margin, ARC, utilization along with organization parameters that are required to be owned, tracked and taken accountability for
  
b. Should be able to manage sales, delivery, customer, internal stakeholders, external stakeholders and should be one SPOC who is accountable for managing end-to-end delivery
  
c. Should have managed at least minimum of 150+ FTE professionals with both onsite and offshore combined with a revenue of close $15m
  
8. Customer stakeholder management
  
a. Should have the experience in terms of managing customer comms, team coms and ensure that agile way of working along with impediment management with team or customer
  
b. Should have an agile way of Governance experience both with teams and customer to measure the progress of delivery
  
c. Should be working as a team leader and follow slave leadership model kind of behavior and should have experience in that mind set of working

title: OpenShift förvaltare
description:
Vi söker en tekniskt skicklig och kommunikativ **OpenShift-specialist** med vana att arbeta med plattformsförvaltning och teamutveckling. Uppdraget innebär att leda och vidareutveckla ett befintligt förvaltningsinitiativ för containerplattformar – med fokus på att säkerställa en stabil, korrekt uppsatt OpenShift-miljö och att stärka det interna teamets tekniska kompetens.


Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i både den tekniska implementationen och den organisatoriska kunskapsöverföringen. Det är därför viktigt att du trivs i en roll där du både är operativt teknisk och pedagogisk, med förmåga att vägleda andra genom strukturerad dokumentation, coachning och utbildning.


Efter uppdragets slut förväntas plattformen vara robust, korrekt konfigurerad samt dokumenterad, och att det befintliga teamet känner sig tryggare och mer självgående i sin fortsatta förvaltning.

### **Vi söker dig som har:**


**Obligatoriska kvalifikationer:**

* Djupgående och flerårig erfarenhet av **OpenShift** samt modern **containerteknik**.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga – både muntligt och skriftligt – med förmåga att överföra teknisk kunskap till andra på ett strukturerat sätt.
* Van att arbeta i team och bidra till gemensam kompetenshöjning.

**Meriterande erfarenheter:**

* Tidigare arbete enligt **PM3-modellen** eller annan etablerad förvaltningsstruktur inom IT.
* Erfarenhet av att **leda tekniska utbildningar eller workshops** i plattforms- och DevOps-miljöer.


**Plats:** Uppsala (100 % på plats)  

**Uppdragsperiod:** 18 augusti – 31 december 2025  

**Omfattning:** 100 %

**Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Apply Now to Devoteam Creative Tech – Your Summer Career Kickstart! (Frontend)
description:
- **Dreaming of a new challenge while enjoying your summer break? Now's your chance to get ahead! Devoteam Creative Tech is growing, and we're looking for passionate, experienced software professionals to join our dynamic consultancy.**

We are a creative and innovative team dedicated to delivering high-quality software solutions. If you're a seasoned developer with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!
  

  

**Who are you?**  

We're looking for individuals who enjoys being at Devoteam or the clients office 3-5 days per week, with a minimum of 5 years of professional frontend experience in one or more of the following:



	* Has worked in larger commercial development projects with min. 3-4 developers
	* Can convey technical complexity to non-technical colleagues (sales, pm, design, customers)
	* In-depth experience in HTML/CSS and PostCSS/pre-processors (e.g. Tailwind, SASS) and modern JavaScript
	* Ideally also have experience working with Typescript
	* Experience in working with different design frameworks and company design systems.
	* In-depth experience with a component-based JavaScript framework such as Vue or React
	* Experience with meta frameworks such as NuxtJS or NextJS
	* Experience with data fetching from various web services and APIs
	* Experience with semantic HTML, SEO and accessibility (a11y) principles
	* Solid experience with modern toolchains and build tools such as ViteJS and Webpack
	* Experience in both manual testing by e.g. Google LightHouse and automated unit/E2E testing with e.g. Vitest or Cypress
	* Experience with Git and SCMs like GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket
	* A plus if you have knowledge and interest in animations and 3D programming with libraries such as GSAP, PixiJS and ThreeJS
	* Experience working in agile working environments using project management tools e.g. Atlassian (Jira, Confluence), GitLab, Azure DevOps
	* Speaks and writes Swedish and English on a social and technical level.**What we offer:**  

**Great location:** A newly renovated office in the centre of Malmö


**Continuous learning:** We support continuous learning with biweekly knowledge- sharing groups, participation in Øredev and ongoing competence development days for your professional development. You have the opportunity to take a certificate with one of our partners (AWS, Azure, GCP) and have access to all Udemy courses.


**Leave and pension:** We offer 30 days of vacation, supplementary parental leave compensation and occupational pension according to ITP1.


**Health and well-being:** Obvious benefits such as wellness allowance, access to occupational health care, health checks and lunch-yoga in the office.


**Tools and equipment:** You choose the tools you need to deliver and thrive in your work environment.
  

  

**Coworkers:** Great, skilled coworkers who appreciate fun activities and techtalks.
  

  

**If you're ready to devote your talent to a company that appreciates quality, fosters growth, and values its people, don't wait! Apply now and let's build something amazing together.**  

  

**Ps. We are currently on summervacation and things will be pretty slow for us right now. But dont worry, we´ll reach out to you as soon as possible!**
