title: Mechanical Engineer- Creo/Inventor/Windchill Implementation
description:
**Introduktion**  
Åt stora statliga kunder söker vi flera personer som har nedan profil! Rekryteringsmöjligheterna dyker upp löpande varför vi tar ansökningar löpande. Se bara till att passa in i profilen som nämns nedan så återkommer vi till dig!

**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**

On behalf of **Tetra Pak** we are looking for a **Mechanical Engineer consultant for Creo/Inventor/Windchill implementation.**

The Organization consists of Business Sectors and Business Streams responsible for different areas of Processing Equipment. The tools used in the different Business Streams are a variety of software and ways of working. The Project is a Business Transformation Project streamlining and changing (initially) CAD/ PDM systems to Creo/Inventor/Windchill and a common way of working. The Consultant will be a part of the central team in Lund that leads project from a global perspective.The Role will primarily be to support the team with expertise within Creo/Windchill and to help facilitate the implementation in the Business Streams.

**The consultant is expected to have the level of experience and skills to:**

* Support the Product Structure lead with input to modularization, attributes, templates etc.
* Support the Way of Working lead with User scenarios, User cases, workflows etc.
* Support the training material lead for CAD/PDM
* Help to integrate the CAD, PDM and/or PLM systems within the organization
* Note that Windchill will not be “out of the box” so a high level of understanding processes is required since the software will be adapted (by the IT team) to fit the organization.
* Be the go-to person during development and implementation
* Your attitude is open minded, and you will help to establish a positive change attitude in the Business Streams (end-users)

**Required skills:**

* Highly skilled in working with Creo (and Inventor) and Windchill
* Background in mechanical engineering

**Soft Skills:**

* Able to drive activities independently and in a team
* Open-minded to new ways of working
* Communication
* An interest in systems and processes

**Preferred skills:**

* You have been part of a project changing CAD/PDM systems before
* You have been a superuser in CREO/Windchill

**Start**: ASAP

**End**: 1 year, with extension possibility

**Travels**: Travels to Business Streams can/will occur in different phases of the project (10-20%)

**Equipment**: The consultant is expected to bring his/her own equipment

**Hours per week**: 100% workload

**Remote work**: Remote work (2 days/week) is possible after onboarding is completed, and the consultant is up and running.

**On-boarding**: Drug test is mandatory before the assignment starts.

We present candidates on an ongoing basis. This means that we sometimes remove the assignment from our website earlier than the last application day. If you are interested in an assignment, we recommend that you apply immediately.

Språk:

* Svenska
* Engelska

Vi ser framemot din ansökan i form av uppdaterad CV!

Team Don Dona Consulting AB

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Förmåner:

* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Företagsevent
* Jobba hemifrån

Erfarenhet:

* liknande roll: 2 år (Obligatoriskt)

Arbetsort: Delvis på distans i Lund

Sista ansökningsdatum: 2025-07-16

title: Design Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Legora, we’re on a mission to transform the way lawyers work. Our AI-native platform lets legal professionals enhance their productivity and automate complex workflows. We collaborate closely with our clients and iterate at a market-leading pace. In a year, we have gone from an early MVP to tools used daily by thousands of lawyers, and are now scaling rapidly. We are here to win together with our team and clients, and carry the belief that life is too short not to accomplish something truly special.
   

  

 You are joining an early stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit, trusted by global leaders like Bird & Bird, Pérez-Llorca, and Mannheimer Swartling. Backed by over $100M in funding from top investors including Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator. And a a world-class team from Google, Klarna, Spotify, and top tier law firms with infinite room to grow professionally.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 We’re hiring a Design Engineer to help us build the most beautiful and intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work across the gap between design and frontend—crafting polished, interactive experiences that make AI feel natural, collaborative, and human. Your job is to bring clarity, motion, and refinement to every corner of the interface.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build elegant, reusable UI with React, TypeScript, and CSS
* Translate Figma designs into refined, real product experiences
* Prototype and explore new interaction patterns—especially around AI workflows
* Add motion and micro-interactions that bring interfaces to life
* Shape our design system alongside designers and engineers
* Raise the visual and interaction quality across the product


 Who you are
   

  

* Strong experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS
* Deep interest in UI design, motion, and detail
* A portfolio that shows taste, craft, and interaction thinking
* Curiosity about how AI changes the way people interact with software
* Drive to build interfaces that are fast to use and delightful to use


 What's in it for you
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work


**We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve.**
 We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Experienced Automotive Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 AVL in Sweden is now looking for a motivated engineer for the Software department in Liljeholmen. We have customer projects and assignments within Software for AD/ADAS, Electric Drive Systems, ICE, HiL/Testing Environment Development etc.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Development of innovative strategies and functions for vehicle systems using modern tools
* Analyze and evalute new/exisiting concepts and solutions
* Technical support for customer projects as well as in internal projects
* Identification of developments in the area of responsibility


**Profile Description**
* Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Electrical / Electronics / Software, Vehicle engineering or comparable. Preferably Master
* At least 2 year of professional and industry experience
* A genuine interest in automotive systems
* Technical control and architecture skills
* Knowledge in MATLAB/Simulink, C/C++/Python
* HiL system knowledge e.g. dSpace, ETAS
* Fluent in English


**Meriting**
* Agile/Scrum methods and processes
* Understanding and awareness of ISO26262
* Driver license B (C and/or D preferred)
* Knowledge of automotive function development process, e.g. V-Cycle, Agile
* E-Drive product (E-Motor, Inverter, DC-DC converter) development experience, SW and/or HW
* Overview of the current EV market and related technology trends


**We Offer**
* Be part of our pioneering work – together with our customers we shape the future of mobility
* Competitive Compensation Package
* Collective Agreement and insurances
* International and innovative collaboration – integrated in our global AVL expert network
* Mobile working, flex-time and a modern new office in Liljeholmen


**Interested?**
 If so, please use our online application tool to send your application to AVL!
   

  

 For more information, contact Bengt Frögelius Bengt.Froegelius@avl.com.
   

  

 As we enter the holiday season, response times may be longer than normal. Thank you for your patience!
